metadata.title: Journal with Me No. 39 | Midori Traveler's Notebook
metadata.description:
Journal with me! Today we use a few paper scraps and some concert memorabilia to make a spread! Come and grab some art supplies and come journal with me. 

As always, if you have any questions, leave them down below. Don’t forget to like, comment, subscribe and share this video with all your stationery obsessed friends! 

Products I love and use:
Tombow Permanent Tape Runner: http://amzn.to/2Ac3mXL
Tombow Permanent Tape Runner Refills: http://amzn.to/2BT7pbC
(Note: These are affiliate links!)

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

LET'S CONNECT:
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/jobsjournal 
Pinterest - https://www.pinterest.com/jobsjournal 

GEAR:
Fujifilm XT1 + 18-55mm: http://amzn.to/2ykudiA 
Vanguard ALTA PRO 263AT tripod: http://amzn.to/2ylcJ5H

nodes.plm_action: Sticking sticky notes and tickets on the book
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person decorating an open journal with various items. The person is carefully adding items and notes into the journal using adhesive and placing other things like photos and tickets on the pages. In the end, the decorated journal is closed and placed on a table.

summary.brief: A creator assembles a concert‑themed journal spread by cutting, coloring, taping and writing on the pages, then ends with a coffee‑and‑journal shot.
summary.detailed: The video opens with the creator opening a black notebook on a white tabletop and tearing a brown envelope to use as a background on the left page. Light peach‑pink watercolor blobs and yellow stripes are added, then the area is secured with a Tombow permanent tape runner. A thin translucent vellum sheet is placed over the left side, and a tiny type‑written Harry Potter quote is glued onto it. A portrait cut‑out is positioned so that the vellum masks the subject’s eyes for a vintage look. Small squares of graph paper are adhered, followed by a gray concert brochure and a ticket stub with an attached tear‑away calendar sheet, all taped in place. Using a brush pen filled with Sumi black ink, the creator writes the concert date and additional notes on the spread, adding a few decorative stickers and other embellishments. The camera pans around the finished pages, briefly shows the creator’s face, and then cuts to a static shot of a black leather journal beside a white mug of coffee while a hand stirs the drink with a spoon.

action.detailed: Arrange and glue paper pieces, photos, tickets, and decorative elements onto the open journal pages, then write the text with a brush pen to finish the layout.
action.actor: the creator of the journal spread

nodes.plm_action: Collage and journaling in the middle of the page with stickers
nodes.plm_caption: This video features an up-close shot of someone working on their journal. Throughout the video, various pieces of art are added to the pages, and the person demonstrates how to use adhesives to stick these pieces in place. The person then uses a ruler to add some notes and a post-it to keep everything organized.

summary.brief: Hands assemble a mixed‑media spread in a black journal, layering paper, watercolor, tape, vellum, photos and ticket items, then pan across the finished page.
summary.detailed: The video opens with a black journal opened on a white tabletop. The creator tears a dark‑brown Korean envelope paper and places it as a background on the left page, and adds a small Kinfolk paper scrap on the right. A light peach‑pink watercolor wash with thin yellow stripes is brushed across the left side. Using a Tombow permanent‑tape runner, strips of tape are applied to secure the paper layers. A tiny vellum sheet bearing a type‑written quote is glued onto the left page, followed by a portrait cut‑out whose eyes are covered, and small squares of graph paper are layered on top, with additional translucent vellum for a smoky effect. On the right page a gray coffee brochure and the concert ticket are affixed, along with a tear‑away calendar strip and other decorative stickers, all fastened with tape and a stapler. The creator then writes labels and dates with black and red pens, including a vertical “Saturday” heading. Throughout the process scissors, a water jar and various supplies are visible. The camera slowly pans over the fully assembled spread, then pulls back to reveal the maker – a man in a black shirt and glasses – seated beside the journal against a white‑covered bed.

action.detailed: Arrange and affix torn paper, watercolor washes, tape, vellum, photos, ticket stubs and handwritten labels onto the pages of the black journal using a tape runner, glue and pens.

nodes.plm_action: Stirring the coffee to create a swirl effect
nodes.plm_caption:
This video features a close-up shot of a man with a black shirt and black mustache and beard and glasses, gesturing with his right hand in front of a dimly lit room and a bedroom bed, lamp and potted plant in the background. At the end, the shot changes to a shot of a black leather journal, and a mug of coffee on a white tabletop. A metal spoon is seen dipping into the coffee, moving out and returning back to it.
The camera is mostly still with a slight head movement up and down. The video cuts at the end.

The scene of the bed with lamp and potted plant in the background is dim and includes a window with closed white Venetian blinds in the upper left of the shot. The cup of coffee and the table with the black journal are shot in a single pan from a high angle.

summary.brief: A man in a black shirt waves and talks to the camera in his bedroom before the view cuts to a hand stirring coffee beside a black journal.
summary.detailed: In a bedroom with a bed, lamp, potted plant and a window covered by white blinds, a bearded man wearing glasses, a black shirt and a black cap faces the camera, extends his right arm, waves, points and makes other gestures while speaking. The shot then cuts to a high‑angle view of a white mug of coffee and a black leather journal on a plain white surface; a metal spoon is lowered into the coffee, stirred a few times in a clockwise motion, lifted out and placed back down as the camera briefly pans the journal and mug.

action.detailed: Raise your right hand and wave at the camera, then dip a metal spoon into the coffee and stir it clockwise before placing the spoon back down.
action.actor: a man wearing a black shirt, beard, glasses and a black cap

nodes.plm_action: Journaling daily using a water brush pen
nodes.plm_caption:
A time lapse video of someone creating a notebook journal. The notebook is black and lies open on a white surface. The person has various bits of paper and tape around them which they begin to put into the notebook. They use black, white and brown colors of paper and tape. They apply black ink using a pen. There is also a black glue gun and a white block of paper lying off to the side. The word "journal" is written in bold black letters at the start of the video. It says "JOURNAL" in the middle of the video. It is all in one long shot with no other objects in it. The music is muted.
The person makes fast movements with their hands while arranging the paper. The camera is static.
Black notebook, brown paper, white paper, scissors, blue cello tape, glue gun, a glass of water, white surface, black ink pen, and a white block of paper.
The word "journal" at the start of the video. The background is plain white with no objects. The lighting is bright and overexposed. There is no sound. The movements are very fast.

summary.brief: A time‑lapse shows a hand assembling a scrapbook spread inside an open black journal.
summary.detailed: The video opens with a bold black “JOURNAL” title on screen, then shows an open black notebook on a bright white tabletop. The creator tears a piece of dark brown envelope paper and places it as a background on the left page, adds light peach‑pink watercolor blobs and yellow stripes, and secures the layer with a Tombow permanent‑tape runner. A translucent vellum sheet bearing a type‑written Harry Potter quote is layered, followed by a portrait cut‑out whose eyes are masked, and several small squares of graph paper are taped on. On the right page a gray coffee‑shop brochure and a Sam Smith concert ticket are affixed, then a small tear‑away calendar sheet is added and layered. The hand uses a brush‑pen with black sumi ink to write brief notes and the word “day” vertically on the left side, then switches to a red pen to add further wording. Finally a white rectangular piece is cut and taped onto the top flap to finish the spread. Throughout the timelapse the hands cut, tape, and arrange papers quickly, with scissors and a blue tape dispenser visible on the table.

action.detailed: Cut, tape, and arrange papers, stickers, tickets, and other embellishments onto the open journal and write notes with brush‑pen and red pen to assemble the scrapbook spread.

nodes.plm_action: Creating daily logs and calendar entries
nodes.plm_caption:
A close up of a book opened to pages that have scrapbook paper taped on top with a clip on the left. The pages are filled with pages and have different things glued on them, there are a bunch of other stuff on the table as well. The camera slowly pans around it to the right and then back towards the left.
It pans around the table showing the black book closed and then it pans back to the open book.
At the end, a man's face appears with a black shirt and glasses. He is sitting near a white bedspread and white wall and there's a table lamp next to him.

summary.brief: A close‑up of an open journal filled with taped scrapbook paper, stickers, a ticket stub and other stationery, ending with the creator’s face beside a bedside lamp.
summary.detailed: The camera pans across an open journal whose left page is held by a metal clip. Its pages are covered in colored scrapbook paper, stickers, handwritten notes, small photos and a ticket stub dated September 10. Office supplies such as a pen, scissors, a binder clip, a calendar page and a gold‑holder‑clipped notebook are visible around the spread. The view moves slowly to the right, showing additional collage elements, then returns toward the left side of the journal. The shot widens to reveal the journal on a white desk with other notebooks and a lamp, and finally the creator’s face appears, wearing a black shirt and glasses, seated near a white‑covered bed and a bedside lamp.

action.detailed: Turn the open journal, panning across its collage‑filled pages to reveal stickers, a ticket stub and surrounding stationery, then pull back to frame the creator’s face beside the lamp.
action.actor: the off‑screen creator handling the journal

nodes.plm_action: Stir the mixture
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a man recording himself  talking to the camera in his room. The video then cuts to a cup of coffee with cream. The man wears a black shirt. His bedroom is in the background. A bedside lamp and a plant are visible. The camera angles cut between the man and the coffee cup.

summary.brief: A man in a black shirt and cap talks to the camera in his bedroom, gestures, then a coffee mug is shown being stirred.
summary.detailed: In a bedroom with a bed, lamp, potted plant and a window covered by white blinds, a man wearing a black shirt, black cap and glasses appears with a cartoon‑style overlay on his face. He looks into the camera, waves his right hand palm up, points upward, to the side and to his own head while speaking. He continues to make various hand gestures, including a V sign near the end. The scene then cuts to a close‑up of a white coffee mug filled with creamy coffee; a spoon is visible stirring the drink in a clockwise motion. The camera briefly returns to the man before ending.

action.detailed: Speak directly to the camera, wave and point with your hands while gesturing, then stir a cup of coffee with a spoon.
action.actor: the man in the black shirt (the video host)

nodes.plm_action: Stir milk into coffee
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a white coffee mug of coffee and a white and black hardcover journal sitting next to each other on a white surface with one hand stirring the coffee.

summary.brief: A right hand stirs coffee in a white mug beside a black leather journal, then the camera settles on the mug and notebook.
summary.detailed: The clip begins with a white ceramic mug filled with coffee sitting on a plain white surface to the right of a closed black leather journal that has a black rope, a gold‑colored circular seal and a rubber band. A right hand lifts a stainless‑steel spoon and circles it in the coffee several times, moving both counter‑clockwise and clockwise, then pulls the spoon out of the mug and exits the frame. After the stirring stops, the scene remains still for a moment before the camera makes a slow pan and a brief zoom toward the mug, highlighting the coffee as the background stays white and the music fades out.

action.detailed: Lift the metal spoon, swirl it in the coffee several times, then lower the spoon and remove the hand from the frame.

nodes.plm_action: Add ticket stub as an embellishment in the journal
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a person engaged in scrapbooking using many materials such as paint, paper, glue, and scissors.
The person starts with a black journal, which is opened onto a white surface. They place brown tape on the journal and add a page from a magazine which reads "Fincas el Verdel" in black text. They then take a small brush and add water-based paint to the journal. They add various materials including a brown pattern, a white ticket, a small photo, and a transparent sticker. The person uses scissors and a tape to create the layout.

summary.brief: Hands assemble a mixed‑media scrapbook page by cutting, coloring, taping, and writing on a black journal.
summary.detailed: The creator opens a black journal on a white tabletop and begins by tearing a brown envelope paper to use as a background on the left page, then adds a light peach‑pink watercolor wash with yellow stripes. Using a Tombow permanent‑tape runner they secure the background, place small squares of graph paper, glue a typewritten Harry Potter quote and a portrait cutout, and overlay transparent vellum for a smoky effect. On the right page they affix a gray coffee‑brochure, a monochrome concert ticket and a tear‑away calendar fragment, arranging everything with tape and glue. Finally they write the words “Saphir” and “day” in cursive black ink with a fine‑tip pen, cover the lettering with a piece of tape, and close the journal, completing the spread.

action.detailed: Cut, arrange, and affix the decorative papers, apply watercolor washes, tape and glue the elements, overlay vellum, write “Saphir day” in cursive ink, and seal the text with tape.

nodes.plm_action: Attaching ticket to page of journal using glue gun
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a close-up time-lapse view of a pair of hands completing DIY art projects, with a notebook as the central workpiece. In the beginning, the hands attach a white rectangle to the pages of the art notebook on the top flap. Next, the person places a ticket printout and securing it with a tape. The next action shown is punching a hole through the paper with an adhesive gun, followed by pasting a second ticket. The final action being performed, is the hand writing words into the notebook using a red pen. At the end, the hands cut another white rectangle and attach it with tape. In the background, a variety of art supplies are seen on a white tabletop.

Small strips of brown patterned paper are added to both pages, followed by a ticket stub and a tiny photograph, which are positioned and pressed into place. The hand continues by cutting additional shapes from a purple sheet, trimming stickers and rectangular pieces, and layering gray, white and gray‑toned papers over the spread. All items are secured with a blue tape dispenser, a Tombow permanent‑tape runner, and occasional transparent glue. Further brown cardstock, white transparent strips with black lettering, and blue‑tape accents are applied, resulting in a fully decorated, multilayered journal spread.

The journal is reopened, the attached paper is lifted out, and another corner is trimmed. The creator flips pages, cuts a strand of binding with the scissors, and cuts decorative shapes from a brown‑paper sheet with white flower motifs, inserting those cut‑outs into the journal. Throughout the segment a glass jar, a water jar, a ticket stub and the blue tape dispenser remain on the white work surface.

nodes.plm_action: Bearing a journal with me
nodes.plm_caption: The video features a timelapse of a person using watercolors and other embellishments in a journal. The video shows the process of turning the journal page by page with an embellishment on it. We see the process from cutting the embellishment down to applying the watercolors to the page. It also shows the journal being turned one page at a time.

summary.brief: Hands assemble paper cutouts and add watercolor to create a journal spread.
summary.detailed:
The clip opens with animated title cards reading “Journal with Me.” An overhead hand then opens a blank journal on a white tabletop. A patterned sheet is placed vertically on the left page, a pale‑yellow sheet is laid horizontally across it and aligned using the fingers. A perforated strip of paper is positioned over the patterned sheet and slid leftward, leaving only its left end visible. The creator cuts small pieces of cardstock, adds a brown label above the cardstock, and places a tiny ticket, a black pad, a collage photo, a receipt, and other cut‑out images onto the pages. A black pin with a coin is attached near the right side, and the black pad is lifted and tossed to the right. 

Next, small scissors trim images from an opened book; the back cover is removed and placed on top of the open pages. Additional cut‑outs are arranged on both sides of the opened book, and a pink watercolor swatch is dabbed onto the closed cover. 

The creator then loads a brush with rose‑gold watercolor and paints four vertical stripes down the left page, adds random colour touches, and makes rapid brush strokes across both pages, repeatedly dipping the brush into paint. Brown patterned paper pieces are laid on the left and right pages as masks; yellow watercolor is applied to the right page, and more brown paper is placed and brushed over. Finally, the hand presses another brown paper onto the centre of the white page, dips the brush in water and drags it across to create a final wash, completing the journal spread.

action.detailed: Cut assorted papers, arrange and tape them onto the open journal pages, then use a brush to apply watercolor washes and stripes across the pages.

nodes.plm_action: Decorate scrapbook pages with paper strips and tickets
nodes.plm_caption: An up-close shot of two hands sticking paper pieces in a black journal or log book. There is a "fincal" sticker on a white background and a pair of scissors next to it on a white surface, along with a transparent jar filled with water and a blue cello tape dispenser. As the video continues, a brown paper piece is added on the left side of the white page of the journal, then the right page is pulled to the right and the hands cut a small, rectangular-shaped sticker to fit at the top middle section, sliding it over and pressing firmly. The right page is then pushed down to the left. The left hand sticks a long, rectangular white transparent plastic strip with black writing on it on the center, sticking another on the right and cutting a small piece in half. It sticks this one at the top left of the brown page, then the right hand cuts another long, rectangular brown paper, sticks it at the top of the paper pieces, and holds it firmly to ensure it stays in place. After sticking the white pieces on the bottom right part of the journal, the hands tape the page pieces onto the journal.

summary.brief: Hands cut, arrange, and tape a variety of paper pieces, stickers, tickets and decorative strips onto an open journal spread.
summary.detailed: The segment opens with the creator’s hands positioning a brown cardstock rectangle on the left page of an open dark journal, followed by a grey rectangle, a white rectangle, a tan piece, black cardstock and a beige strip, and a ticket stub placed on the right page. A "Finca" sticker and a page‑protecting sheet are applied over the top, then trimmed with scissors. A small rectangular sticker is cut to fit the top‑center of the right page and pressed into place. Transparent plastic strips printed with black text are laid across the centre of the spread; one strip is cut in half and a piece is stuck at the top‑left of the brown cardstock. A longer brown paper strip is cut, adhered across the top of the assembled elements and held firmly. Additional white transparent strips are placed in the bottom‑right corner. Throughout the process the creator uses a blue cello‑tape dispenser, double‑sided tape and a glue stick to secure each element, occasionally folding and pressing paper before gluing. After the initial layout, the hands continue adding a photograph, another adhesive strip, a ticket, more brown paper rectangles, and apply blue glue then transparent glue to affix them. A large piece of adhesive tape is placed on both sides of a brown paper strip and pressed onto the page, followed by a small piece of brown tape. Finally, a blue mini‑tape dispenser is used to tape a small picture, and a sticker is glued onto a small wooden stick that is set beside the journal.

action.detailed: Place, cut, and adhere the various paper pieces, stickers, tickets, and tape onto the open journal, arranging each element as described and securing them with scissors, tape dispenser, and glue.

nodes.plm_action: Cut out ticket stub and place it inside book
nodes.plm_caption:
This video shows a person's hands opening a journal and sticking various pieces of paper onto it in order to create a mixed medium book. A pair of black scissors can be seen on the left of the frame. It's hard to tell when the paper has been removed from the cover, but it seems to be some kind of journal with large letters on the front and small pictures on it.
The person places a small paper card onto the book. Using his thumb and index finger of both hands he sticks it onto the book. The person then cuts through the corner of another paper card with scissors and puts the cut-off corner onto the journal. He adds more papers onto the journal. The person then tapes a long piece of paper onto the journal using a glue stick. The person then puts the back cover on the journal, sticking it down. The person opens the journal and takes out the attached paper. He then cuts through the corner of the paper with scissors.
A small blue tape dispenser can be seen on the right of the frame.

summary.brief: Hands tap, glue and cut paper pieces onto an open journal before closing it.
summary.detailed: The creator’s hands open the journal and press a small paper card onto the left side of the spread. A corner of another card is trimmed with black scissors and placed on the page, followed by additional paper scraps. A long strip of paper is adhered with a glue stick and smoothed down. The back cover is pressed onto the journal, then the book is opened again and the newly attached paper is removed and its corner is cut once more. Glue is applied along the edges of a black‑and‑white photograph and a grey pamphlet, which are then positioned on the page and secured with thin blue tape along their edges. A larger cut‑out page bearing bold text is inserted into the middle of the scrapbook, excess paper is trimmed with scissors, and finally the journal is closed.

action.detailed: Open the journal, press small paper cards onto the spread, trim corners with scissors, secure pieces with tape or glue, press the back cover down, reopen to adjust and cut another corner, glue a photo and pamphlet and tape their edges, insert a larger cut‑out page into the middle, trim excess paper, and close the journal.

nodes.plm_action: Cutting out stickers and photographs from magazine pages
nodes.plm_caption: A person's hands are shown performing various tasks on a small leather book. Their left hand is used to turn pages, while their right hand holds scissors. The background is white and there are other things scattered around. A blue seal tape dispenser is to the right. The person writes "saphir" and "day" in cursive in black ink using a fine-tip black pen in their right hand.

summary.brief: Hands open a black journal, cut and arrange paper, tape it, and write “saphir” and “day” in cursive.
summary.detailed: The creator opens a small black leather journal and flips through the pages with the left hand while the right hand holds black scissors. Strips of paper are cut from a brown‑and‑white sheet and placed onto the spread, and a corner of a page is trimmed. Clear tape is pressed over the arranged pieces. Using a fine‑tip black pen, the hands write the word “saphir” in cursive on the page, then write the word “day” on a separate sheet held in the left hand. After the writing is finished the page is lifted, completing the decorated journal layout.

action.detailed: Open the journal, cut and arrange paper pieces, apply a strip of tape over them, and write the words “saphir” and “day” in cursive with a fine‑tip black pen.

nodes.plm_action: Applying a piece of tape to the inside of a small paper box
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a top-down shot of a white table with assorted supplies such as a pair of scissors, a blue tape dispenser, and a handheld stampin' up. The work involves lifting a small, rectangular piece of paper with printed black text onto a sheet of clear packing tape, sticking it to a receipt, and folding it over and taping down on the back. The person is demonstrating how to use this process on an art journal. There is a mason jar full of water in the upper left corner.

summary.brief: Paper scraps, tickets and a receipt are glued, taped and stapled onto a journal spread.
summary.detailed: From a top‑down view the maker first applies glue to a small label that reads “day,” adds a few stickers and writes on a transparent sheet with a blue marker. A tiny printed rectangle is then placed on a strip of clear packing tape, stuck onto a receipt, folded over and taped on the back. Next, ticket stubs are positioned on a paper note, secured briefly with pins or a binder clip, and then stapled into the journal. After that the hands flip additional tickets, smooth them onto the page, cut one ticket in half, glue the pieces, and roll a strip of black tape over them. The segment ends with the creator pulling a stapler forward to finish the spread. Throughout the process a blue handheld tape dispenser, black scissors, a glass jar of water, a mug and other small supplies remain on the white tabletop, and the creator’s hands are visible while wearing blue denim shorts.

action.brief: Attach paper elements to a journal
action.detailed: Using a glue stick, clear packing tape, double‑sided tape, scissors and a stapler, the person places labels, stickers, ticket stubs and a receipt onto an open journal page, folds, cuts and secures each piece before smoothing them down.
action.actor: The person (hands visible, wearing blue denim shorts) working at the tabletop

nodes.plm_action: Applying washi tape to a piece of paper to serve as a label
nodes.plm_caption:
A person's hands are sticking down small strips of paper in a black photo album. The album is on a white table with a water glass in the top left corner. Black handled scissors, a tape dispenser and a black roller are on the table. The paper being stuck down is white with black writing on it.
The person sticks down the strips of paper with a black stapler and presses down. The person adjusts the strip of paper then flips the page and sticks down a strip on the opposite side of the paper.

summary.brief: Hands staple white paper strips with black text onto an open black scrapbook.
summary.detailed: The camera stays focused on a white tabletop where a black scrapbook lies open. The maker picks up thin white strips printed with black lettering, positions them on the left‑hand page and presses a black stapler onto each strip to secure it. After a brief adjustment of the strip, the page is turned and the same process is repeated on the opposite side of the spread. Scissors, a tape dispenser, a black roller and a glass of water remain visible around the work area.

action.detailed: Place each white strip onto the page, press the black stapler firmly to attach the strip, adjust its position as needed, flip the page, and repeat the stapling on the other side.

nodes.plm_action: Adding ticket stubs to pages using paper tape
nodes.plm_caption: This video shows the top of a small, bound art book with pictures and words inside. A white table sits underneath the open art book and has a pair of scissors, tape dispenser, a clear glass of water and other supplies.

summary.brief: Hands attach a concert ticket and tape to a scrapbook page, then flip the spread to reveal a dated card.
summary.detailed: In a close‑up view, the creator’s hands pick up a blue tape dispenser and apply temporary paper strips to the left page of an open scrapbook. They then place a concert ticket stub and other paper pieces onto that page, using scissors and clothespins as needed while a glass of water sits nearby. After securing the items, the hands lift the right side of the spread and turn the page, exposing a small card on the opposite page that shows the date “2013/06/01” and a barcode.

action.detailed: Apply temporary paper strips, position and tape a concert ticket and other paper elements onto the left page, then flip the spread to reveal a calendar card on the right page.

nodes.plm_action: Writing in the "Saphir" section of the notebook
nodes.plm_caption: This video shows an overhead shot of two hands writing and marking in a book. A music video plays at the beginning. The book is an art journal, and is resting on a white table surrounded by writing and art supplies. The person first makes a pen mark at the top right corner of the book, and then writes "10 10th in another corner of the page, then he draws a line down the page. He takes out another piece of paper, which has a different color grid on the other side, and makes some more writing at the top left corner of the page. Then he takes out a pen, and continues writing, before eventually putting away the pen and paper. Then the music video plays before going to black.

summary.brief: Hands write, outline, and tape a journal page while using a ruler to add the word “saphi‑r”.
summary.detailed: An overhead camera looks down at an open journal on a white tabletop surrounded by pens, tape, a stamp, a grid sheet, and other stationery. The creator points at existing words on the page, picks up a pen and stamps a small piece of paper. They write with a black pen, then outline the top edge of the page using a blue‑coloured pen. A clear strip of tape is placed over the spread. A grid‑patterned sheet is positioned on the left side, and a clear ruler is used to guide the lettering of the word “saphi‑r”, first in red ink and then finished in blue ink. After the writing is done, the tools are set aside and the video fades to black.

action.detailed: Write new text, outline the page edge with blue pen, apply clear tape, place the grid sheet, and use a ruler to write the word “saphi‑r” first in red then in blue ink.

nodes.plm_action: Flipping through pages to find specific dates
nodes.plm_caption:
A video of a scrapbook that is laid out on a table and is being flipped through. The scrapbook says saturday on the top of the pages and there is a date of september 10th on the bottom of one of the pages. There are several different objects laying next to the scrapbook.
The camera slowly moves from left to right until it reaches the right end of the scrapbook and then it moves back to the left end. At the 0:02 mark the video goes around to the scrapbook from the left end to the right end.
There is a white desk under the scrapbook and a few objects laying on the desk. At the 0:03 mark there is a brown book on the desk to the left of the scrapbook and it has a round brown base on the desk. It is holding a clear glass. The glass is filled with clear liquid. At the 0:05 mark the object at the center of the screen to the right of the scrapbook flips over on the table and sits back down. The background of the screen is white.
At the 0:06 there is an object to the left of the scrapbook that is attached to the book with black tape. It has an arrow on it pointing to the right with black cursive writing. The writing says, " your life may be different when you are at work (but).". At the 0:09 there is a black pen next to the edge of the scrapbook and then on the desk. The pen is to the right of the clear glass that is on the brown book.

summary.brief: A hand flips through an open scrapbook and planner, showing dated pages, taped notes, tickets and surrounding stationery.
summary.detailed: The segment opens on an open scrapbook resting on a white desk. The camera pans slowly from the left side of the spread to the right, revealing a top‑left label “Saturday” and a bottom‑right date “September 10”. A taped strip of paper bears the handwritten note “your life may be different when you are at work (but)”. Near the left side a brown‑covered book holds a clear glass filled with liquid, and a black pen sits beside it. The view then returns to the left side. A hand appears in the lower‑right corner and turns the pages, moving the spread left‑to‑right and back while exposing additional decorated pages that include a ticket stub, a quote about happiness, stickers and a gold binder clip. The camera then focuses on a planner opened to the same date, with the ticket placed on the calendar page, a pen on the right, scissors on the left, and other office supplies (paper clips, a black notebook, a water glass) arranged around it. Apart from the page‑turning hand, the scene remains largely static.

action.detailed: Turn the scrapbook and planner pages, moving the spread from left to right and back while revealing dated entries, taped notes, tickets and surrounding stationery.

nodes.plm_action: Organizing a notebook's pages
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a table with a journal, a phonebook, a water jar, and some papers. The video pans over the table and focuses on a jar filled with water and a black straw. The camera then pans back to the journal and the table. There are some glasses in the corner of the shot.

nodes.plm_action: Use scrapbook paper to create embellishments
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a black notebook, a black pair of scissors and various other items sitting on a white table. A colorful piece of paper is clipped to the left page.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image shows a flat lay of a journal, scissors, and other stationery items on a white surface. The purpose of the image is to showcase the contents of the journal and the surrounding stationery items.

* A journal with a clip on the left page:
	+ The journal is open to two pages.
	+ The left page has a clip attached to it.
	+ The right page has a piece of paper with writing on it.
* A pair of scissors next to the journal:
	+ The scissors are black and have a circular handle.
	+ They are placed next to the journal, on the left side.
* A black notebook on the right side of the journal:
	+ The notebook is closed.
	+ It is placed next to the journal, on the right side.

The image suggests that the person who owns the journal is a creative and organized individual who enjoys writing and crafting. The presence of the scissors and notebook implies that they may also enjoy drawing or sketching.

nodes.plm_action: Holding up the journal to examine its contents
nodes.plm_caption: The video features a shot of a personal diary that includes a notebook, a small brown bag, a pair of black scissors, and a pen. The notebook has the name "Satcher" on it. The diary is written about the person's daily life or activities, which is indicated by the different entries and entries on each page. Overall, the video showcases a beautiful and organized personal diary that helps the person keep track of their daily life and activities.
nodes.llama3_caption:
This image presents a flat lay of various office supplies and a journal on a white table.

The journal, situated on the left, features a page with "Saturday" written in cursive at the top, followed by a list of notes in black handwriting. To the right, the journal's page is open to a page with "Sunday" and "Monday" written in black, accompanied by a calendar page. The calendar displays "Sunday" at the top, with "10" written below, and a list of days of the week in black text. The journal is surrounded by black scissors on the left and a black notebook on the right. Above the journal, additional office supplies are visible, including a roll of tape, a pen, and a small black container.

The background of the image is a plain white table.

nodes.plm_action: Adding ticket stubs and personal items to the binder
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a scrapbook layout that was made using the "the in ccc" line to make a tag or sticker. The scrapbook pages show various designs, images, and text with gold, brown and tan colors. The pages show a collage of flowers, leaves, and a small photo.  There's also an attached paper that says," happiness can be found even in the darkest of times if one only turns to the light. I'm happy it makes me no promises"
In the upper left is another scrapbook page with a gold clip and a white paper that has the dates "September 10 Montag. W01"

summary.brief: A close‑up pans across two scrapbook pages showing a ticket clipped with a binder clip and a decorative collage featuring a happiness quote, floral stickers, a photograph and a September 10 Montag label.
summary.detailed: The camera moves from right to left over two open scrapbook pages held together by a black binder clip. On the left page a white ticket stub is secured with the clip, next to a Ticketmaster sticker and a handwritten note that reads “I have no promises.” The view then shifts to the adjacent page, which is a pastel collage of brown, gold and tan papers. A typewriter‑style quote reads “Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times if one only remembers to turn on the light,” and is layered over a floral‑patterned rectangle. Below the quote sits a small black‑and‑white photograph of a woman wearing a beaded necklace, surrounded by additional floral stickers, a gold accent and a date label that says “September 10 Montag W01.”

action.detailed: Turn the pages of the scrapbook, sliding the binder‑clipped ticket into view and then revealing the decorative collage with the happiness quote, floral stickers, a photograph and the September 10 Montag label.

nodes.plm_action: Create personalized journal pages using a scrapbook page layout
nodes.plm_caption:
A woman is flipping through a journal that contains an entry from September 10, on a Monday, from her life. There is a watch. There is a black notebook with a pen on top of it. There are also some binder clips in there.
The woman has a journal that she is flipping through. On the left side, there is a clipboard that is held in a pen holder and there is an entry from Saturday, September 8, from her life. Then, on the right side of the journal, there is a calendar that says "September 10th Monday". Below the date, there is a ticket. On the left side of the journal, there is also a page with the word "Saturdays" written on it. Also, the journal has writing and pictures on both sides.
On a table, there is a clip that is attached to the journal. There is a zip pen holder attached to the journal. There are three binder clips next to the journal. There is a pencil case that is brown and orange next to the journal. There is also a notebook on the far right that is black. At the top of the journal, there is a lamp and a plant in a vase. On top of the table, there is a bed with white covers and pillows. There is a window behind the bed.

summary.brief: A close‑up of an open journal spread being flipped, showing a collage of papers, a September 10 calendar with a ticket, and a black‑background scrapbook page before ending on a blurred face of a man.
summary.detailed: The camera focuses on an open journal lying on a white surface. On the left‑hand page a label that reads “SATUR” appears next to a collage of cut‑out papers: a brown floral‑patterned sheet, a pink‑white marbled sheet, a tan sheet with black lettering, a post‑it note, a small card marked “r‑”, and a picture, all held together by a gold‑tone binder clip. An open pen and a pair of tweezers rest near the page. The right‑hand page shows a calendar layout for September 10 (Monday) with the date and the number “27”, and a printed ticket stub is placed on top of the calendar. A gold binder clip and a black pen lie on the spread, and a pair of scissors is also visible. The view then pans to a separate scrapbook page that has a black background; a concert ticket bearing the word “montag” is attached in the centre, and a pen and a small black notebook sit beside the page. A watch can be seen near the bottom right of the shot. The segment finishes with a blurry view of a man’s face – a bearded man wearing a white shirt and red suspenders – in a dimly lit bedroom setting.

action.detailed: Turn the pages of the open journal to reveal the left‑hand collage and the right‑hand calendar with ticket, then pan across the scrapbook page with its ticket, pen and notebook while the camera moves, ending with a blurred view of a man’s face.
action.actor: The journal owner (off‑camera) flipping through the journal

Near the end he grabs the side of his black cap with his right hand. The background remains steady throughout.

nodes.plm_action: consumed by coffee

The scene is static with no movement. The white background shows a slight contrast, but no detail is distinguishable. It shows light bouncing off the cup and the book.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image presents a top-down view of a black leather journal and a cup of coffee on a white surface. The journal, positioned on the left side of the image, features a circular copper-colored logo on its cover, which appears to be a simple design with a hole at the top. A small, black, metal clip is attached to the top of the journal, allowing it to be closed. The journal is placed at an angle, with its bottom-left corner pointing towards the top-left corner of the image.

On the right side of the image, a white mug filled with a light-brown liquid, likely coffee or tea, sits on the white surface. The mug's handle is visible, and its contents are depicted in a light brown color. The background of the image is a plain white surface, providing a clean and minimalist setting for the journal and mug.

Overall, the image suggests that the journal and mug are being used for writing or reading purposes, possibly in a quiet and peaceful environment. The simple and elegant design of the journal and the warm color of the coffee or tea in the mug create a cozy and inviting atmosphere.

nodes.plm_action: prepare and boil water
nodes.plm_caption: It is a still shot of a plain white surface, and on that surface is a black notebook and a white coffee cup filled with brown liquid. In a shot made with some sort of filter, there is a slight grayish green blur on the liquid in the coffee cup. The liquid is moving up and down in the cup, like a current. The video also has a few flicks.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a top-down view of a black leather journal and a cup of coffee on a white surface. 

The journal is positioned on the left side of the image, with a small, round, brown logo in the center of its cover. The journal has a black elastic band closure and a black pen or pencil tucked into the top-left corner. 

To the right of the journal is a white coffee mug filled with a light brown liquid, likely coffee. The mug has a white handle and a small shadow is cast to the right of the mug. 

The background of the image is a plain white surface, possibly a table or desk.

nodes.plm_action: plan out your week
nodes.plm_caption: A still shot of a black notebook next to a full white cup of coffee. A thin black string wrapped around the notebook holds down a round silver tag on the front cover. The notebook and coffee cup rest on a plain white surface.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a simple, yet inviting scene of a black leather journal and a cup of coffee on a white surface. The journal, situated on the left side of the image, features a circular, brown logo on its cover, which is closed. The journal is positioned at an angle, with its top left corner pointing towards the upper left corner of the image. A small, black elastic band is visible near the top of the journal, suggesting that it may be designed to hold pens or other writing instruments.

To the right of the journal lies a white mug, filled with a light-brown liquid that appears to be coffee. The mug is positioned at an angle, with its handle facing the right side of the image. The background of the image is a plain white surface, which provides a clean and minimalist backdrop for the journal and coffee mug. Overall, the image conveys a sense of simplicity, elegance, and a quiet moment of reflection or creativity.

nodes.plm_action: article 13: the little red book
nodes.plm_caption:
This video features an elegant view of a black notebook with a gold tie around it and a full cup of coffee. The items sit on a clean white table. The camera slowly pans slowly across to the white cup to show the coffee. This is followed by a small zoom in from left to right, while music plays throughout. The video ends with the zoom in on the coffee and music fading out.

The lighting in the video is bright and even, with no harsh shadows or bright spots. The focus is sharp, and the camera remains steady throughout. The background is a plain white, which helps to emphasize the black notebook and white coffee cup. Overall, the video has a clean and minimalist aesthetic.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image presents a serene and organized workspace, featuring a black leather journal and a white coffee mug with a brown liquid, set against a clean white background. The overall atmosphere is one of simplicity and productivity.

* A black leather journal with a brown circle on it:
	+ The journal is positioned on the left side of the image.
	+ It has a smooth, matte finish and a subtle sheen to it.
	+ The brown circle on the cover appears to be a decorative element or a logo.
* A white coffee mug with a brown liquid in it:
	+ The mug is placed on the right side of the image, opposite the journal.
	+ The brown liquid inside the mug suggests that it contains coffee or tea.
	+ The mug's handle is visible, indicating that it is ready for use.
* The background is a plain white surface:
	+ The background is a solid, unadorned white color.
	+ There are no visible textures or patterns on the surface.
	+ The plain background helps to focus attention on the journal and mug.

Overall, the image conveys a sense of calmness and focus, suggesting that the person using these items is engaged in a quiet, creative activity. The simplicity of the background and the minimalistic design of the journal and mug create a clean and uncluttered visual space.

nodes.plm_action: Placing items in their designated spots
nodes.plm_caption: This video features an assortment of paper being placed on a journal. The pieces of paper are of different size and pattern and are pasted by hand on different pages of a journal.

summary.brief: A hand opens a journal and methodically arranges patterned, colored and perforated papers while briefly moving a black pad across the spread.
summary.detailed: The segment opens with a yellow‑black title screen that reads “Journal with me.” An overhead view then shows the journal unclipped and opened on a white table. The hand places a patterned sheet vertically on the page, followed by a pale‑yellow sheet positioned horizontally so its long edges line up with the patterned sheet; the right edge is held down with the right hand’s index finger while the left hand presses the left edge into place. Next, a strip of paper with holes is placed at the right edge of the patterned sheet, its ends pressed together, and the strip is slid leftward until only its left end remains visible. A small ticket with black writing and black scissors sit on the left side of the journal as a printed sheet is briefly lifted and removed. A black pad and a larger white sheet then enter the frame from the left; the hand lifts the black pad and tosses it toward the right side of the table. A small black pin with a coin attached is visible on the journal’s right edge. Near the end, the hand turns the pages of a nearby book and places the book beside the open journal. Finally, the “Journal with me” title reappears in the top‑left corner before the segment cuts away.

action.detailed: Place the patterned sheet vertically, align and press the pale‑yellow sheet horizontally, attach the perforated strip and slide it across the page, then lift the black pad and toss it to the right.

nodes.plm_action: Applying watercolor paint to pages of a journal
nodes.plm_caption: An overhead view of a journal, a white tabletop, and a person’s hand cutting small pictures with black scissors before inserting them into the journal's spine. The journal is opened to reveal that it is empty. The person picks up two sheets of paper with text on them and inserts the first sheet on the right side of the journal, which starts to show it's contents. At the same time, the person dabs a wet paintbrush on the edges of the watercolor and begins to paint on the journal. The person places a small strip of brown paper in the journal, then dabs it with paint and pulls it out. The person then adds another strip of brown paper to the journal.

summary.brief: Hands cut picture cutouts, insert them and text sheets into an open journal, dab pink watercolor on the cover, paint watercolor stripes and washes on the pages, and layer brown patterned paper strips.
summary.detailed: The creator opens the journal on a white tabletop and uses small black scissors to cut tiny picture pieces from a book, placing the cutouts into the spine. Two sheets of paper with printed text are positioned on the right side of the spread, revealing their content. A pink watercolor swatch is dabbed onto the closed cover with a brush. Then, using a paintbrush loaded with watercolor, thin vertical stripes and quick brush strokes are applied across the left and right pages. After painting, a textured brown paper strip with gold embossing is pressed onto the left page, lifted, and another brown strip is placed; later a second brown strip is added to the right page. Finally, a wash of white watercolor is brushed onto the left page and a yellow watercolor wash is brushed down the centre of the right page, each followed by an additional brown patterned paper layer.

action.detailed: Cut picture cutouts, insert them and two text sheets into the open journal, dab pink watercolor onto the cover, paint colored watercolor strokes and stripes on the pages, and layer brown patterned paper strips while adding watercolor washes.
action.actor: the person creating the journal (hands visible)

nodes.plm_action: Attaching ticket stub to page using glue
nodes.plm_caption:
In this video, a person is seen preparing a notebook. There is a glass jar, a scissor, a purple paper on the table and more. On the table, there is a notebook with brown and pink papers in it. 
The person begins by placing a brown rectangle on the left side of the notebook. Then he places the next paper rectangle on the left side. He places a gray paper rectangle, followed by another white paper rectangle, followed by a ticket on the right side of the notebook. After that, he places a paper on the left side. He cuts a piece of paper from the purple paper on the table and places it on the right side of the notebook.
The person then takes the ticket and cuts both edges.  He then places it on the left side of the notebook with a paper rectangle above it. He takes the purple paper on the right of the paper on the table and cuts it into half before placing it on top of the other paper on the left. He then proceeds to take the sticker on the right of the purple paper and stick it on the left of the paper. He then takes the other sticker that's on the right and sticks it on the right side of the notebook and sticks the paper on the table over it. He then takes the black scissors on the right and cuts both ends of the purple paper on the table. He then takes a sticker on the left, and he is trying to place it on the right side of the notebook with a rectangle of paper on top of it. The sticker is too big to stick it properly and he removes it from the notebook. The person uses scissors to cut both ends of the sticker to try to place it properly on the right side of the notebook.

summary.brief: Hands arrange paper cutouts, a ticket and a photo on an open journal page and trim them with scissors.
summary.detailed: The creator spreads an open journal on a white tabletop and begins by placing a brown cardstock rectangle on the left side of the page. A grey paper rectangle is added next to it, followed by white, tan and beige paper pieces that are layered on the left side. A small ticket stub is positioned on the right side of the spread, and a photograph is placed near the centre. Blue tape from a handheld dispenser is used to secure several of the layers. The hands then cut away excess edges of the ticket and the paper pieces with black scissors, trimming the items so they fit neatly within the layout. Throughout the segment the process is sped up, showing quick placement, taping, and cutting of the various elements.

action.detailed: Place the brown, grey, white, tan and beige paper pieces, the ticket and the photo onto the open journal page, secure them with tape, and cut the excess edges with scissors to fit the layout.

nodes.plm_action: Sticking tags over journal entry
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a close up of a hands cutting out and pasting cards and papers onto a book of paper as music plays and a book sits open on a white table in the middle of the room. There is a glass on the top left of the screen.
The person keeps adding cards and papers of different colours onto the book, with a piece of tape held in the right hand and pressing the card onto the book with the left hand.
At the 15 second mark the music stops, then plays again at 15 seconds.

summary.brief: Hands cut, tape and glue paper pieces, a ticket and a photo onto an open journal page.
summary.detailed: An open journal lies on a white tabletop while a pair of hands work on it. Thin brown and pink cardstock are cut with black scissors and positioned on the page alongside a ticket stub and a small photograph. The pieces are first pressed down with a blue adhesive tool, then secured with transparent double‑sided tape and short strips from a blue tape dispenser, including a small piece of brown tape at a corner. A length of double‑sided tape is peeled from its roll and applied to a rectangular brown paper piece, which is later glued on both sides with a blue glue gun that is dropped after use. A wooden stick receives a sticker, a paperclip is placed with a thin strip of paper, and the assembled paper is flipped to reveal a hidden pink layer beneath.

action.detailed: Cut and arrange paper elements, then adhere them to the open journal page using a blue adhesive tool, double‑sided tape, and a glue gun while adding a ticket, photo and decorative pieces.

nodes.plm_action: Put a piece of tape, double-tap
nodes.plm_caption: The video features a woman's hands engaged in a scrapbook-related activity, with the camera perspective positioned above. The woman is surrounded by a few objects on a white table. At 3s, she uses a pair of scissors to cut and position small pieces of paper. At 6s, she rotates the book and starts tearing the paper to create a design. The woman's actions are focused on the scrapbook and materials, with minimal dialogue.

summary.brief: Hands apply tape, trim and arrange paper on a journal page, then flip the page to reveal the finished spread.
summary.detailed: The crafter first places a clear strip of tape horizontally across the centre of an open journal page. A rectangular piece of white paper is laid onto the tape, and the excess edges are trimmed with scissors. Additional strips of tape are added to secure the layers and the collage is smoothed and recentred. Finally the page is lifted and the journal is opened, showing the completed spread and a cellophane‑covered page with text.

action.detailed: Press a strip of clear tape across the middle of the open page, position a white paper piece on the tape, trim the excess with scissors, add further tape strips to hold everything in place, smooth the layers, then lift and open the page to display the finished collage.

nodes.plm_action: Applying adhesive to paper pieces and attaching them to the page
nodes.plm_caption: In the first 10 seconds, you can see a person holding a book with various pictures in the center of the page and then gluing some of those pictures in the back of the book with a blue adhesive.  In the final 6 seconds, you can see the person making a space in the front of the book.

summary.brief: The maker tapes a photograph and pamphlet to the back of a spread, then inserts and trims a new sheet on the front.
summary.detailed: The creator holds a black‑and‑white photograph and a gray pamphlet against an open journal page and runs strips of blue tape from the dispenser along the left, top and bottom edges, securing the items to the back of the spread before lifting the pamphlet away. Next, a white sheet with printed text is placed onto an open page of the scrapbook; the hands press it firmly down and slide it into position, adding another paper element as needed. Finally, the book is opened again, scissors are used to cut away a strip of paper on the front page, creating a space, and the page is then closed.

action.detailed: Place the photograph and pamphlet on the journal page, secure them with blue tape, press a new sheet onto the front of the journal, and cut a strip to create a space.

nodes.plm_action: Folding the paper in half and cutting off excess pages
nodes.plm_caption: This video features an individual showing how to design a blank journal.

summary.brief: The creator opens a black journal, flips its pages, and uses scissors to trim a page corner, cut decorative paper and snip a cord inside the notebook.
summary.detailed: The segment starts with a fast‑forward view of a black‑covered journal opened to its white pages on a white tabletop, the pages being turned and the book rotated while nearby items such as a tape dispenser, a receipt and a glass are visible. The hands then pick up a small pad, briefly set it down and lift it again. The pace slows as black‑handled scissors appear; the creator trims the corner of a page and cuts a brown sheet printed with white flowers from its centre, placing the cut piece back into the journal. Finally, the scissors are used to cut a thin black cord that runs through the middle of the open notebook, all actions performed with careful hand movements.

action.detailed: Using black scissors, the person trims a page corner, cuts a decorative brown‑and‑white paper shape, and snips a black cord inside the open black journal, positioning the cut pieces back into the notebook.

nodes.plm_action: Adding name and signature to each page with black pen
nodes.plm_caption: A top down view of a person's hands using black marker to write the name "Saptir" on a paper book while pressing down a piece of tape over the writing. The book is black and lying on a white surface. On the top left is a blue and clear tape dispenser and a pair of scissors lying vertically on the right. In the top left corner, a glass jar with ice. The video is in high definition, the scene is well lit.

summary.brief: Hands write a word on a black journal page and seal it with clear tape.
summary.detailed: From a top‑down perspective an open black journal lies on a white tabletop surrounded by a blue tape dispenser, a pair of black‑handled scissors, and a glass jar of ice. The creator holds a black marker in the right hand and steadies the page with the left hand, writing a word onto the paper. A piece of clear tape is then cut from the dispenser and pressed over the fresh ink, securing it. The surrounding supplies stay visible throughout the segment.

action.detailed: Hold a black marker in the right hand, steady the open black journal with the left hand, write a word on the page, cut a piece of clear tape from the blue dispenser, and press the tape onto the ink to seal it.

nodes.plm_action: Adding ticket stub to the "day" section
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a small diary being decorated with paper, stickers and pens. We also see a small blue tap. All other objects are on a white surface. The only way to tell this is a diary and is it being decorated and put together. It looks like the diary is being carefully assembled with pieces of paper and placed side by side on each other. One of the pages has the words, "sabados," written in black. There is a small bottle of water to the left of the book and a pair of scissors and a small blue tap is to the right of the book. The small grey rectangular sticker has numbers from 1 to 3 written in black on it, the book and the other sticker are placed next to each other at the same height of 2 and a half. The small bottle of water has a drop in the middle of it and to the right is a black colored tape and a small white tap. The small sticker has words "Sapporo" written in black on it. The background of the video is a plain white surface, there is also a small section of black to the left and a small section of brown at the far left of the screen.

summary.brief: The creator glues a “day” label onto the diary, adds numbered and “Sapporo” stickers, writes a few blue‑marker marks through a clear sheet, and then secures a ticket with two white pins.
summary.detailed: A top‑down view shows the creator’s hands over an open diary on a white surface. First, a glue stick is rubbed on the top edge of a small piece of paper that reads “day” and the paper is pressed onto the left side of the spread. A clear sheet is placed over the page and a blue‑marker pen is used to make two or three short strokes through the sheet onto the paper. Next, a grey rectangular sticker printed with the numbers 1‑3 and a separate black‑text sticker that says “Sapporo” are positioned side‑by‑side at the same height on the page. Finally, a ticket is laid onto the diary page and each corner is fastened with a small white square pin, after which the pins are lifted from the ticket.

action.detailed: Apply glue to the “day” paper, press it onto the diary page, write short blue‑marker marks through a clear sheet, place the numbered and “Sapporo” stickers on the spread, then lay the ticket on the page and secure it with two white pins.

nodes.plm_action: nail down or stick together
nodes.plm_caption: The video features a shot of a book or journal from directly overhead. A person's hands appear from bottom frame and begin taping tickets to the pages. There is a scissor, tape dispenser, and other items lying around. They have to turn the page and apply tape. They tape two tickets to the page. They put tape on a third ticket then begin to grab another tool from the bottom right of the frame. The video ends.

summary.brief: Hands tape, cut and glue concert tickets onto a scrapbook page.
summary.detailed: From a top‑down view the creator removes the backing from two concert tickets, smooths each ticket onto the centre of an open journal page and positions them side‑by‑side. Using a blue handheld double‑sided tape dispenser, tape is applied to the backs of the tickets; one ticket is then cut in half with black scissors and all pieces are placed on the page. A tape roller is rolled over the taped areas to press them down, a black stapler is pulled forward for later stapling, and finally a hot‑glue gun is used to add glue along a strip of paper, firmly securing the tickets. Scissors, the tape dispenser, a glass of water and other small supplies remain visible on the white desk.

action.detailed: Place the tickets on the page, trim one in half, apply double‑sided tape with the blue dispenser, roll tape over the taped areas, and finish by securing them with a stapler and hot‑glue.

nodes.plm_action: Punch hole along edge of paper
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a person's hands holding a cutting tool over an open book. The book is open with a black binder clip on one of the pages; the contents visible are pieces of cardstock, a receipt, and a photo, with a booklet with a " capturing" logo on the top. There is a pair of scissors on a white surface at the bottom of the screen. The person is holding the tool in the right hand with the blade at the edge of an open book, the left hand is gripping the edge of the tool.

summary.brief: Hands trim paper pieces in an open journal using a handheld cutter.
summary.detailed: The creator places a black binder‑clipped page of the journal on a white surface, where a receipt, a photo and other cardstock fragments are visible. Holding a handheld cutting tool in the right hand, they press the blade against the edge of the open page and slide it to cut the paper elements, while the left hand steadies the tool. A pair of scissors rests nearby on the surface.

action.detailed: Press the handheld cutter’s blade onto the edge of the open, binder‑clipped journal page and draw it across to slice the visible cardstock, receipt and photo, then reposition the cutter as needed.
action.actor: The video creator (the person making the journal spread)

nodes.plm_action: Applying tape to secure page into place
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a person sticking up a paper into a notebook on a white table. They cut a piece of tape and stick it on top of the paper. Then they press the paper into the notebook. A pair of scissors and a water bottle are visible as well as a large black stapler in the top right corner.

summary.brief: Hands tape a cut piece of paper onto an open journal page and then adjust the layout.
summary.detailed: On a bright white tabletop, the creator’s hands pull a length of blue tape from a dispenser, place the tape onto the edge of a cut sheet of paper, and press the paper onto an open journal spread, securing it with the tape. Scissors, a water bottle and a large black stapler sit nearby but are not used. After the paper is adhered, the hands lift and gently reposition or remove the attached pieces in a brief slow‑motion segment, while additional scrap‑booking materials remain scattered on the table.

action.detailed: Place the cut sheet of paper onto the open journal, apply a strip of tape from the dispenser to secure it, press firmly, then lift or reposition the paper as needed.

nodes.plm_action: stick with the tape and trim
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a notebook opened on a table and a person's hands picking and putting down various items. There is also a pair of black scissors next to the notebook. The items appear to be related to scrapbooking, with a blue transparent tape dispenser visible.
A glass of water can be seen at the top left of the frame. At the top left corner, the person's right arm is visible moving and picking up a brown object.
The lighting is good.

summary.brief: The creator positions a concert ticket stub onto an open scrapbook page while handling nearby crafting tools.
summary.detailed: The clip opens with a quick, sped‑up view of the creator’s hand laying temporary paper strips across the open pages. The hand moves from the left side of the desk, briefly passes a glass of water, and reaches toward a blue tape dispenser and a pair of black‑handed scissors that sit on the surface. After the strips are placed, the creator picks up a concert ticket stub, places it on the right‑hand page of the scrapbook, and adjusts its position among the surrounding tools, including scissors, white clothespins, and the tape dispenser, completing that section of the spread.

action.detailed: Place the concert ticket stub onto the open scrapbook page and adjust its placement using the nearby scissors, clothespins, and tape dispenser.

nodes.plm_action: Attaching washi tape to pages of journal to secure them in place
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a notebook sitting on a table. The title of the page is written in cursive, but is a little cut off. The notebook appears to have been decorated. A pair of hands come into the frame at the bottom to flip the page.

summary.brief: Hands flip a decorated journal page, revealing the next sheet.
summary.detailed: A top‑down view shows an open notebook on a white tabletop; the left page displays a partially visible cursive title and decorative elements. From the bottom of the frame a pair of hands enters, lifts the right edge of the spread and turns the page downward, exposing the following page before the hands exit the view.

action.detailed: Turn the right side of the open journal down to reveal the next page.

nodes.plm_action: Writing notes or journaling
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person writing in a scrapbook filled with clippings, newspaper and other memorabilia. The shots are sped up so that the person's hand is moving quickly across the page. The video ends with the person adding a card as a design element to the page.

summary.brief: Fast‑forwarded close‑up of hands writing, stamping and adding decorative touches to an open journal page.
summary.detailed: The segment opens on an open journal spread held on a white tabletop. The creator flips a strip of clear tape, then writes a few cursive notes with a pen in the lower‑left corner while a small stamp is pressed onto the paper. The hand continues to write across the page, moves the pen cap back on, and briefly zooms out to show surrounding supplies such as scissors, a tape dispenser and a glass of water. In the next fast‑forwarded portion the writer adds more short markings with a red or black pen, outlines the top edge of the page with a thin blue pen, places a piece of transparent tape over part of the layout, and finally positions a small card as a finishing decorative element before the hand exits the frame.

action.detailed: Write notes with a pen, press a stamp onto the page, outline the top edge with a blue pen, apply clear tape, and add a decorative card to the open journal page.

nodes.plm_action: Writing on paper with a pen
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a person writing some words on a piece of paper with a pen. They are using a ruler to write in a uniform style. The video is sped up slightly, so the writing appears to be faster than it actually is. The person stops writing and then picks up the pen to write again. The lighting is bright, and the scene is set on a white surface.

summary.brief: Hands use a ruler and colored pens to write decorative text on an open journal page.
summary.detailed: The clip begins with the creator’s hands placing a clear ruler (and a strip of clear tape) across an open journal page on a bright white table. Using a red pen they write the word “Saphir” in cursive, then switch to a blue pen to finish the lettering while gently adjusting the ruler for guidance. The notebook is slid left‑to‑right as the writing continues. Toward the end of the segment the hand picks up a black Sharpie and adds the label “finances” on another page, then sets the pen down as the camera pulls back to reveal the completed spread.

action.detailed: Place a ruler on the journal page, use a red pen to write “Saphir” in cursive, continue with a blue pen, slide the notebook across the surface while writing, and finish by using a black Sharpie to label a section “finances”.

nodes.plm_action: Adding handwritten notes to journal entries using a gold clip
nodes.plm_caption: This video features an art journal with a clip holding it together. The journal has been decorated with writing and has two pages with images and words on them.

summary.brief: A gold‑clipped scrapbook is flipped, showing a ticket stub with a date, a collage with the numbers 10 and the words Saturday/Friday, a “Happiness” page with a portrait, and an old typewriter photo before returning to the start.
summary.detailed: The camera focuses on a scrapbook held open by a gold binder clip on a white tabletop. The first spread features a ticket stub taped to the bottom‑right edge, a handwritten note and a pair of scissors nearby. The view then moves to the next spread, a mixed collage of black ink drawings and text with a calendar‑style date (the number 10 and the words Saturday and Friday) in the top‑right corner. The following page displays the word “Happiness” in black inside a larger brown rectangle, a date beneath it, and a small portrait of a woman. The next spread shows a photograph of an old typewriter. The camera continues to flip through the book, briefly returning to the original ticket‑stub spread held by the gold clip, then cycles through the pages again and ends on the first page.

action.detailed: Turn the scrapbook pages quickly, moving from the ticket‑stub spread to the dated collage, then to the “Happiness” page, followed by the typewriter photo, and back to the original spread, while the gold clip holds the pages in place.

nodes.plm_action: Using scrapbook paper in a journal entry for September 10th
nodes.plm_caption: A video of a notebook, and office supplies on a desk, with music playing.

summary.brief: A hand flips an open journal page that shows a September 10 calendar with a ticket among assorted stationery.
summary.detailed: The shot begins with a hand in the lower‑right corner lifting a gold binder clip and turning the page of a planner journal. As the page flips, a spread is revealed that contains a calendar marked September 10 (displayed as “10 MONDAY” or “Saturday the 10th”), a ticket or receipt taped to the page, handwritten notes, stickers and a few small photos. The journal is held open by the clip and sits on a white desk surrounded by various office supplies—a pair of scissors, a white pen, other notebooks, a pencil case, a water glass on a coaster, and a black case with a silver pen. After the page is turned, the camera pans slightly to the right, showing additional items such as a black binder with a brown circular button, red paper clamps, and more pens.

action.detailed: Lift the gold binder clip and flip the journal page, exposing the September 10 calendar spread with a ticket and nearby stationery while the camera pans across the desk.
action.actor: A hand (presumably the creator’s) turning the pages of the journal

nodes.plm_action: Holding up a book to show the planner inside
nodes.plm_caption: The camera pans in on an open planner. The open planner has sections with paper and the name "safur" written on the page.  On the right side of the open planner is a calendar with September 10th marked. The camera pans out to show the rest of the table. There is a closed planner with an exposed pen and a gold band that opens the binder. There is a glass jar filled with water and two skinny straws and is on a wooden coaster. A pair of black scissors sits next to the open planner. The video ends with a second pan on the jar showing the straws moving in the jar.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image presents a serene and organized workspace, with a white table as the backdrop. On the left side of the table, a glass jar filled with water and a paintbrush resting inside creates a sense of calmness. The jar is placed on a wooden coaster, adding a touch of warmth to the scene.

In the center of the image, a black binder with a copper circle on the front cover takes center stage. A silver pen lies beside it, ready for use.
