nodes.plm_action: Placing a ticket on a page in the journal
nodes.plm_caption:
The video is an overhead view of a person opening a journal and pulling out different kinds of paper to add to the pages. The person is very careful and precise.
The video starts with the word "Journal with me" on the top left of the screen in yellow text. The title cuts away when a person is holding a small stack of paper. The stack is flipped up and the white sheets of paper are revealed.

The person lays the stack flat against a white background on the bottom left of the screen, on top of the journal, which opens up towards the center of the screen. The person then grabs a piece of paper with a pattern on it and lays it vertically flat on top of the white page of the journal. The person then takes another piece of paper, this one solid and pale yellow, and places it horizontally, with the longer ends of the paper aligned with the longer end of the paper with the pattern on it. The person holds the right end of the yellow piece of paper down on the left end of the paper with the pattern on it with their right hand's index finger. The left hand then pushes the left end of the yellow piece of paper onto the paper with the pattern on it with their left hand's thumb, middle finger, and index finger.
The video cuts to an open journal on a white background with an empty white page and a piece of paper with a pattern on it laid horizontally across the center of the page. The video then cuts to the person holding one end of a strip of paper with holes in it on the right end. The person is holding the strip against the paper with the pattern on it and uses their thumbs and index fingers to press the ends of the strip onto the ends of the paper with the pattern on it on the right side. The person moves the strip horizontally towards the left end of the paper with the pattern on it. At the end of the video, the person moves the right end of the strip past the right end of the paper with the pattern on it, with only the left end of the strip visible on the left side of the screen.

At the end of the video, the words "journal with me" cut away on the top left of the screen.

summary.brief: The hands arrange patterned and yellow papers on an open journal, slide a perforated strip across them, then briefly handle a printed sheet and toss a black pad to the right.
summary.detailed: The segment begins with a yellow “journal with me” graphic while a top‑down view shows an open journal on a white surface; a small stack of paper is flipped open, revealing white sheets. A patterned sheet is placed on the journal page, and a pale‑yellow sheet is overlaid horizontally, its edges pressed into place. Next, a strip of paper with holes is held against the patterned sheet, its ends pressed and the strip slid leftward until only its left end remains visible. After a brief cut, the view shifts to a brown‑covered journal with scissors and a ticket; a hand enters from the left, lifts a printed sheet and exits, then a black pad and a large white sheet move in from the left. The hand returns, lifts the black pad and tosses it toward the right side of the frame, and the yellow graphic fades away.

action.detailed: Place a patterned sheet on the journal page, overlay a pale‑yellow sheet and press its edges into place, press a perforated strip onto the patterned sheet and slide it leftward, then lift the black pad and toss it to the right while briefly handling a printed sheet.

The hands are shown holding and manipulating various craft items. The hands appear to be working on a creative project involving paper, scissors, and glue. The person using various materials to construct something.

summary.brief: The hands tape a small picture, glue a sticker onto a wooden stick and attach it, then glue and tape additional paper pieces before revealing a hidden pink section.
summary.detailed: First, a length of blue double‑sided tape is pulled from a mini dispenser, pressed onto a small picture or ticket and rubbed to secure it. Next, a flat wooden stick is picked up, a tiny sticker is glued onto the stick, and the stick is placed onto the taped picture as a decorative accent. Afterwards, the back of a rectangular paper piece is coated with glue, the piece is flipped and its edge is glued with a hot‑glue gun before being positioned on the journal page. Finally, a clear strip of tape is applied to a longer paper strip, which is then flipped to expose a concealed pink area beneath cut‑out sections.

action.detailed: Apply double‑sided tape to the picture, glue a sticker onto the wooden stick and place the stick on the tape, glue and hot‑glue additional paper pieces onto the page, then apply clear tape to a strip and flip it to reveal the hidden pink section.

nodes.plm_action: Adding a piece of tape between each page
nodes.plm_caption:
A person is using tape to attach items to a page in a scrapbook. The person is working with various craft supplies on a white surface, and the camera is in closeup. Two sets of hands are visible in the frame, and the camera moves slightly but quickly. You can see the person's fingers and arms working and the other side of their body on the left, out of frame. They're moving quickly and the camera is also fast.
At the beginning of the video, the hands appear to press the items down onto the page in the middle. When the tape is cut, the hands lift the next item into position to tape it on the page. At the end of the video, the hands place another piece of tape on the page, and the person adjusts the items to center it on the page.
Scissors, blue tape dispenser, water jar, and ticket stub can be seen on the surface the items are on.

summary.brief: Hands tape, cut and seal a scrapbook page.
summary.detailed: The camera stays close on an open journal page set on a white desk. First a thin strip of tape is laid horizontally across the middle of the spread. A rectangular piece of white paper is positioned on the taped area, then the hands trim the excess paper on the right and left edges with scissors, pulling the trimmed piece away. Next, layers of brown banner paper, brown squares and a white rectangle are added one by one onto the page. After the layered collage is in place, the creator peels off the existing clear protective film from the pages, flattens the spread, cuts away excess film with the scissors and applies a fresh piece of clear tape from the blue dispenser to the top corner to re‑seal the page. Finally the elements are nudged so the composition is centered. Scissors, a blue tape dispenser, a water jar, a ticket stub and a ring on the right hand remain visible on the surface.

action.detailed: Place a strip of tape on the open page, position paper pieces, cut away excess with scissors, peel off the existing clear film, apply a fresh piece of clear tape from the dispenser, and adjust the layout to center it.

nodes.plm_action: Remove the sticker from the book
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person removing a page from a small book that appears to be a diary. This page has a letter inside of the book that is typed out in spanish and the title of the diary is partially visible on the page that is still in the book. There is a ticket on the right hand side of the desk, a glass mason jar, and a pair of scissors on the left hand side of the desk.

nodes.plm_action: Using double-sided tape to adhere scrap pieces to a page
nodes.plm_caption:
The video features a person using glue and applying it on a black and white photograph, and a grey pamphlet. The photo is also placed in a book. There are paper scraps around as well.
The person lifts the photo and pamphlet with their left hand, with all the fingers except the thumb used. They apply glue along the left edge of the paper then the top edge in a zigzag motion and finally the bottom edge. They use their right hand. Once done applying the glue they remove the pamphlet from the table.

summary.brief: The creator tapes the edges of a black‑and‑white photo and a gray pamphlet before placing them on the journal page.
summary.detailed: The creator lifts a black‑and‑white photograph and a gray pamphlet with the left hand, using all fingers except the thumb to grip them. With the right hand they operate a small blue tape dispenser, pressing a strip of tape along the left edge, then running it in a zig‑zag pattern across the top edge, and finally along the bottom edge of each item. After the tape is applied, the taped photograph and pamphlet are positioned onto the open spread of the journal while assorted paper scraps remain scattered on the white workspace.

action.detailed: Using a blue tape dispenser, the person presses tape along the left, top and bottom edges of a photograph and a pamphlet held in the left hand, then places the taped items onto the journal spread.

nodes.plm_action: Glue a page onto the back of the notebook
nodes.plm_caption: This video captures a person working on a scrapbook. We only see their hands. The first time the hands place a piece of paper into a scrapbook. Then the hands push the paper down firmly. The next time, the hands grab the scissors and some additional paper and put it on the scrapbook.

summary.brief: Hands place, press, cut, and rearrange papers within a scrapbook spread.
summary.detailed: The camera shows only the crafter’s hands over a white tabletop. First a white sheet printed with black text is positioned onto an open page of the journal and pressed down, with a bit of transparent tape used to hold it. A larger sheet bearing the fragmented word “fincat” is then laid into the spread and held in place while nearby items such as a ticket stub, a mason‑jar and scissors remain on the table. The hands pick up black scissors, cut the bottom edge of the sheet, lift the cut strip away, and then move a clear plastic pocket‑protector that sits on the left page, slipping a brown paper card underneath it before the book is closed.

action.detailed: Place the printed sheet onto the journal page, press it down firmly, cut its bottom edge with scissors, lift the cut strip away, reposition the pocket protector and insert a brown card beneath it, then close the spread.

nodes.plm_action: Opening a new page in a journal
nodes.plm_caption: The video features an open journal. The person in the video has a pair of scissors, and other journaling items near the journal on the table they are on. The video is in fast forward motion.

summary.brief: Hands flip pages of a black journal, handle a small sketch pad, and quickly open another notebook.
summary.detailed: First, the creator places a stack of blank paper on a black‑covered notebook, puts a pair of scissors aside, and taps the bottom of the open page. They then grasp the right‑hand corner of a white page, push it outward, and lift the page up, repeating the motion to turn several pages of the journal. Next, they pick up a small white sketch pad, let it fall onto the left side of the white desk, rotate it upright so the pages face the camera, and set it back down. Finally, in a sped‑up clip, they set another journal on the desk, lift its corner and open it fully while a blue push‑pin rests to the right.

action.detailed: Grab the corner of the black journal with your thumb and fingers, lift and flip the page outward, repeat to turn several pages, then pick up the small sketch pad, drop it onto the left side, rotate it upright, and finally place another journal on the desk, lift its corner and open it fully.

nodes.plm_action: Cutting the string off the pages
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a close up of someone's hands cutting string from the book of a book and opening more pages. The book is black, the pages are white, and a brown and white page is behind the white. The white pages are flipped by the hands holding the book, cutting string with black scissors and paper clips are near a brown paper on the left and a blue tape measure on the right side of the shot and a clear glass is on the left side of the shot.

summary.brief: Hands trim a notebook page, cut decorative paper pieces, and cut a cord inside the journal.
summary.detailed: The creator opens a black‑covered journal on a white desk, steadies it with the left hand and uses black‑handled scissors in the right hand to trim a corner of a page. Next, scissors cut shapes from a brown sheet printed with white flowers, and the cut pieces are placed onto the open spread and tucked into the notebook. After the decorative pieces are positioned, the left hand holds the pages while the scissors slice a thin black cord attached inside the journal, finishing with a quick slide of a page out of the book.

action.detailed: Hold the notebook steady with the left hand, use the right‑hand scissors to trim the page edge, cut shapes from the brown‑and‑white decorative sheet, insert the cut pieces into the open spread, then cut the black cord inside the journal while keeping the pages held.
action.actor: the creator’s hands (left hand holding the notebook, right hand holding scissors)

nodes.plm_action: Applying tape to protect paper while glue dries
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person using various supplies to make a handmade scrapbook layout. The video consists of a few different clip-style shots. The background of the video is a white surface, with a glass jar in the top left corner of the shot and a dark-colored ticket to the right. It ends with the person closing the open scrapbook with a piece of tape, with a pen in their hand and an open page in their left hand. A blue tape dispenser is sitting to the right of the scrapbook.

summary.brief: Hands cut paper, tape it onto a journal page, and seal the spread with a final strip of tape while holding a pen.
summary.detailed: The creator cuts a strip of paper with scissors and places it on a black journal page, then cuts a piece of clear tape from a blue dispenser and presses the tape over the paper to affix it. After the taped piece is lifted, it is folded in half and turned over. A small artwork is then positioned in the centre of the page and secured with another piece of tape. Finally, the open journal is closed and a last strip of tape is applied to hold the pages together as the hand holds a black pen.

action.brief: Apply tape to secure scrapbook elements
action.detailed: Cut paper pieces, position them on the journal page, cut clear tape from the dispenser, lay the tape over the pieces and press to adhere, fold the taped piece, place a small artwork in the centre and secure it with tape, then close the journal and seal the spread with a final strip of tape while holding a pen.

nodes.plm_action: Adding personal details to the pocket
nodes.plm_caption: The video displays a pair of hands and a black pen over a notebook. The background shows a few items on a plain, white table. The video is set to some pleasant, relaxing music. The video is in portrait view and is played at a fast pace. The camera remains fixed throughout and is not moving. The only visible item is the hand holding the pen, which remains out of the frame from 0:12 until 0:19.  In total, there are four objects visible in the frame.

summary.brief: Hands write short words on an open journal page, then place a strip of tape and write “day” on it.
summary.detailed: The camera stays fixed on a white tabletop while a pair of hands work on an open journal. The right hand holds a black pen and, in stop‑motion style, writes several brief words in cursive on the left and right sides of the page, sometimes moving a small picture to cover the area before writing. After the initial lettering, the page is turned and a clear strip of tape is laid across the page. The pen is then used to write the word “day” directly on the taped section. Throughout the clip a pair of scissors with a blue handle, a blue measuring tape, a concert ticket, and a glass of water remain visible on the table.

action.brief: write on journal page and tape
action.detailed: Hold a black pen in the right hand to write brief words on the open journal, then place a strip of clear tape across the page and write the word “day” on the tape while the left hand steadies the paper.

nodes.plm_action: Applying transparent tape to protect writing from water
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a person's hands working on an art project. There is a piece of paper with the word "day" written on it, attached to a book or frame. The person applies a glue stick to the top edge of the paper and then sticks it down.
The person is working with crafting supplies on a white table. A glue stick is on the right side of the table. There is also a black pen on the right side of the table. On the left side of the table there is a small clear jar with water in it. In the left hand of the person is a small piece of paper or card.
The person's hands are working carefully on the project, with a steady focus and attention to detail. The lighting is bright and clear, showing the textures and colors of the materials being worked with.

summary.brief: The creator glues a small “day” label onto the journal page, tapes it, and then secures a new page in the binder with a clip.
summary.detailed: The hands lift an open journal spread and position a tiny piece of paper that reads “day” (written in cursive) beside the word “safe”. A glue stick is run along the top edge of the paper and the glued edge is pressed onto the left‑hand page, adhering it to the spread. A short strip of clear tape is placed over the glued area. The creator then moves to the right side of the spread, positions a new page that already contains the word “Safi” into the black binder, and uses a small black‑and‑white binder clip to hold the page (and a transparent piece of paper) together, tapping briefly to set the adhesive.

action.detailed: Apply glue to the top of the tiny “day” paper, press it onto the journal page, cover the glued edge with clear tape, place the new page into the binder and lock it with a binder clip while tapping to set the adhesive.

nodes.plm_action: Folding the ticket over the edge of the page
nodes.plm_caption:
A top-down view of a hand can be seen placing a ticket into a paper note on a desk. The ticket is then stapled down into a small white book. A pair of scissors and tape can be seen resting on a white table, with a glass of water at the top left corner.
It begins with a pair of hands being shown grabbing a small ticket and laying it down on a black book cover for the paper note. The left index finger and thumb are shown holding the left of the paper with the hands moving back on the ticket to push it down onto the book. Then both of the hands are shown sticking a white square pin on the white back of the ticket. The ticket is stuck in two opposite corners of the pin. The hands are removed but the fingers are shown. The pin is then put in a white box. The left hand is holding the bottom part of the pin to show it sticking. Then the left hand reaches down to the left side and takes a white square pin, holding the back with the left hand and pushing it down onto the paper note with the right hand. The paper note is lifted with the right hand and then put back down on the black book cover. The white square pin is removed from the right side and is then held in the left hand. The video ends with both hands putting the left and right square pins to the left, holding the paper down and the middle finger is sticking on the ticket.
On the left of the frame, a hand can be seen and a small brown box with a circle in the middle of the lid. This box is put down on the white desk at 7 seconds in.

summary.brief: The hands place a ticket onto a journal page, clip it with pins and then staple it in place.
summary.detailed: From a top‑down view the presenter’s right hand lifts a small concert ticket and sets it onto an open black‑bound journal that lies on a white desk. The left hand steadies the page while the ticket is aligned, and two small white square pins are pressed onto opposite corners of the ticket to hold it temporarily. After the pins are set aside, a stapler is brought into the frame; the hand presses the stapler down, driving a staple through the ticket and the surrounding paper so the ticket becomes permanently attached to the spread. Throughout the segment a glass of water, a blue tape dispenser and a pair of black‑handled scissors remain visible on the surface, but no further actions occur before the shot ends.

action.detailed: Place the ticket onto the journal page, secure it briefly with pins, and then fasten it permanently with a stapler.

nodes.plm_action: Applying clear liquid glue to the ticket
nodes.plm_caption:
A top-down view of hands placing tickets in a binder. A table full of supplies, such as a bottle of water and a pair of scissors. The table has white, flat surface. In a black binder, there are letters and a ticket that is being placed on top of it. The ticket is the focal point. To the right of the binder, there is a pair of scissors. The left of the binder, a small water glass and another small white binder. In the person's hand are two tickets. They are flipping them over and placing them in the binder. Then they grab the blue handheld tape dispenser. The video is shot with a short amount of camera time. It is fast motion. In the shot, there is a small bar at the 5-second mark.
The person places the tickets in the binder in a diagonal orientation, one at a time, starting with the first, then the second. Then finally, they place them in a horizontal position, side-by-side, on top of the other tickets.
The video is shot with a short amount of camera time. It is fast motion. In the shot, there is a small bar at the 5-second mark.

summary.brief: The creator arranges two tickets on an open journal page, smooths them, and secures them with double‑sided tape while craft supplies remain on the desk.
summary.detailed: In a top‑down view, a pair of hands lifts two ticket stubs, flips each over and presses them onto the left side of an open black binder page, smoothing them with the fingertips. The tickets are first positioned diagonally, then adjusted to lie side‑by‑side in a horizontal line. A blue handheld double‑sided tape dispenser is then used to adhere the tickets to the page. Throughout the fast‑paced sequence, scissors, a water glass and other crafting items stay visible on the white tabletop.

action.detailed: Place the two tickets onto the open journal page, smooth them with your fingertips, align them side‑by‑side, and secure them with double‑sided tape.

nodes.plm_action: Adding a sticker to the page
nodes.plm_caption:
In a white desk, a scrapbook and a small bottle of blue tape lies open. Two tickets were glued on the middle of scrapbook. One of the tickets is cut into two, then each piece was glued to the scrapbook. While a small blue tape roller is placed on the white surface beside the scissors and the scrapbook. A glass of water is also there. A black tape is rolled out on the top of the ticket. In a moment, a black stapler is pulled out to the front of the white surface
In the video, The scene is set in a white flat desk. A piece of scrapbook is kept open, with small bottle of blue tape lying next to it. The person puts two tickets on the middle of the scrapbook, as he glues them to the page. The tickets were cut into two, and then the person glues each piece of the two tickets on the scrapbook. The blue tape roller is sitting on the white surface next to the scissors and the scrapbook. In the video also, a glass of water is kept on the white surface. The person rolls the black tape to the top of the ticket to be glued. In the end, a black stapler is being pulled to the front of the white surface.

summary.brief: Hands attach concert tickets to an open scrapbook page, cutting, taping, gluing, and then pulling a stapler into view.
summary.detailed: A close‑up of a white desk shows the maker’s hands working on an opened scrapbook. Two concert tickets are placed in the centre of the page; one ticket is cut in half and each half is positioned on the spread. Blue double‑sided tape from a small dispenser is applied to the backs of the ticket pieces to stick them down, and a strip of black adhesive tape is rolled over the tops. A drop of glue (shown as a hot‑glue application) is then added to further secure the pieces. Finally, a black stapler is pulled forward across the surface while scissors, the tape dispenser and a glass of water remain on the desk.

action.detailed: Cut one ticket in half, position the halves on the open scrapbook page, secure them with blue double‑sided tape, overlay black tape, apply glue, and pull a black stapler forward across the desk.

nodes.plm_action: Using a date stamp machine to create custom dates in the journal
nodes.plm_caption:
A person is using a device in their hands while demonstrating the various functions. The top of the device seems to be a dial, and the front includes various symbols and colors. The person places the device over the pages of a book on the white surface and presses down on its head. They then reposition the device over the book. The hand is visible from the wrist to the fingertips.
The hand is visible from the wrist to the fingertips.
There are some objects of various colors and shades on the white surface, including scissors, a jar and a small book. The book is brown in color and seems to have some writing in black marker. There is also a pair of black scissors that can be used to cut paper or other objects. Additionally, a small jar and a small book with brown cover that contains some details are present on the table. A black hole puncher with a white sticker is held in the person's right hand and can be used for various tasks.

nodes.plm_action: Punches holes in journal cover using a paper punch
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person applying glue to some fabric around an object. The fabric is attached to an object that may be a round shape of some sort. The person's left hand holds the fabric and their right hand holds the glue gun. There is a scissor to the right of them, some paper, and a transparent jar with some items inside.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a person's hands holding a camera, with a notebook and scissors nearby. The purpose of the image is to showcase the person's creative process, possibly for a blog or social media post.

Here are the details of the image:

* A person's hands holding a camera:
	+ The person's hands are visible, holding the camera with both hands.
	+ The camera is black with a yellow sticker on it.
	+ The person's fingers are wrapped around the camera, suggesting they are taking a photo.
* A notebook with writing and drawings on it:
	+ The notebook is open, revealing a page with writing and drawings.
	+ The writing is in black ink, with some words and phrases highlighted in red.
	+ There are also some doodles and sketches on the page, possibly related to photography or art.
* A pair of scissors:
	+ The scissors are placed to the right of the notebook.
	+ They are black with a silver blade.
	+ The scissors appear to be a standard pair, used for cutting paper or other materials.

Overall, the image suggests that the person is a creative individual who enjoys photography and art. The presence of the notebook and scissors implies that they may be working on a project or idea, possibly related to their photography hobby.

nodes.plm_action: Attaching small black and white image of label to page using glue stick
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a person preparing materials on a white workbench. The person is seen adding the word "safer" to a scrapbook. There are supplies on the workbench such as scissors, a blue tape dispenser, and a black and white marker, as well as a jar of water and paper. A black plastic gun is also on the workbench. The person's hands are shown at the very bottom of the video.

summary.brief: Hands load tape, cut a “safer” label and stick it onto a scrapbook page.
summary.detailed: From a top‑down view of a white workbench, the maker places a roll of black tape into a blue tape dispenser beside a clipboard. They then cut a small piece of paper that reads “safer” with scissors. After positioning a strip of adhesive, the label is pressed onto the open scrapbook page, while other small paper pieces and tools (scissors, stapler gun) remain nearby.

action.detailed: Load the tape into the dispenser, cut the “safer” paper label, apply adhesive, and press the label onto the scrapbook page.

nodes.plm_action: Covering journaling with a piece of transparent paper using a small square shape
nodes.plm_caption: A person is working on a scrap book. The book is open to two pages with various bits of cut paper on each. The first page has writing on it, and the second page has a ticket stub on it. The book is black with pages of various colors and writing on it. The person is using their hands to move the pieces of paper. They are trying to remove them from the scrapbook. The video is played in slow motion. The background is white, and on the white table there are more scrap materials around the person, a pair of scissors, a tape, and a jar of water. There is a black stamp that is lying on its side, and some of the contents are spilling out. The person's hand moves away from the camera.
nodes.llama3_caption:
This image depicts a person engaged in a creative activity, surrounded by various crafting materials and tools.

In the foreground, the individual's left hand is prominently featured, holding a piece of paper or cardstock with a distinctive design. The paper appears to be a scrapbook page, showcasing a mix of images and text. Notably, the word "Saturday" is written in black cursive at the top of the page, while the word "Fin..." is partially visible in large black letters near the bottom. Adjacent to the page is a pair of scissors, accompanied by a small blue object that resembles a hole punch.

The background of the image features a white surface, likely a table or desk, with additional crafting materials scattered about. These include a glass of water, a white eraser, and a black and white object that could be a piece of paper or fabric. The overall atmosphere suggests a person in the midst of a creative project, surrounded by the tools and materials necessary for their craft.

nodes.plm_action: Applying double-sided tape to attach photos and tickets
nodes.plm_caption:
A person is applying temporary paper strips on the pages. The video is sped up to show the process happening in a matter of seconds.
The video is sped up. At 0:02, an arm appears from the left. The arm moves from left to right, touching the water on the clear bottle.

summary.brief: The creator quickly applies temporary paper tape strips to an open journal page.
summary.detailed: In this short sped‑up clip the journal is open to a white page that shows the words “Sappur” and “anneley” beside a brown page titled “Fin”. A blue tape dispenser, a clear water jar, black scissors and a hole‑punch lie on the white surface. The creator’s hands move rapidly, pulling strips of temporary paper tape from the dispenser, positioning each strip on the page and pressing it into place. After placing a few strips, the hand lifts one item, puts it back on the table, picks up another, and continues arranging the tape until the segment ends.

action.detailed: Pull a strip of temporary paper tape from the dispenser, place it onto the journal page, press it firmly, and repeat the motion quickly while handling the tape and other tools.
action.actor: The person creating the journal spread

nodes.plm_action: nail down or stick together
nodes.plm_caption: The video is a close-up of a scrapbook open on a table in front of a person. The scrapbook shows a ticket stub for a concert. Next to the scrapbook is a pair of black-handled scissors with a pair of white plastic clothespins on the table, above the book. The scrapbook sits on a white table with other items surrounding it. A glass cup or jar is to the upper-left and a blue tape dispenser is to the left and slightly below the book.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a flat lay of various items on a white surface, with the focus being on a book or journal. The purpose of the image appears to be showcasing the contents of the book or journal, which is open to two pages.

* A book or journal with a black cover:
	+ The book is open to two pages.

The presence of the glass of water implies that the person who owns the book or journal may be taking a break or working on a project that requires hydration.

nodes.plm_action: Applying tape to the outside of a ticket stub
nodes.plm_caption:
In this video, someone is demonstrating how to journal with scissors, a stapler, a tape dispenser, glue, paper, a small white box, and clear glue. The items are placed on a white table top, with a book opened in front. The book is titled "Saphur" and has a black cover. The video shows hands preparing to start and demonstrating how to use all the tools.
At the beginning of the video, there is a book on the table, opened, with the left page in white with a black lettering, saying "Saphur". The right page is covered with a piece of white tape, so the page is not visible. 

At 0:11, the right hand of the person comes into the frame and is preparing to flip the page down. At 0:13, the right hand of the person flips the page down, revealing a 2013 calendar date, "2013/06/01", that is printed on a small card and also on the right page of the book. The calendar also includes a barcode.

The video ends with the right hand of the person back out of the frame.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image presents a top-down view of a desk, showcasing a notebook with a collage of papers and words, accompanied by various office supplies. The purpose of the image appears to be decorative or inspirational, as it features a visually appealing arrangement of items.

* A notebook with a collage of papers and words:
	+ The notebook is open to a page with a collage of papers and words.
	+ The papers are arranged in a seemingly random pattern, with some overlapping or covering others.
	+ The words are written in different fonts and sizes, with some appearing to be handwritten.
	+ The overall effect is one of creativity and playfulness.

	+ The scissors are placed to the right of the notebook, with their blades closed.
	+ They appear to be a standard pair of office scissors, with a simple design and no notable features.
	+ The scissors add a sense of functionality to the image, suggesting that the person using the notebook is also engaged in creative work.
* A glass of water:
	+ The glass of water is located in the top-left corner of the image.
	+ It is filled to the brim, with no ice or other additions.
	+ The glass is clear, allowing the water to be visible inside.
	+ The presence of the glass of water adds a sense of refreshment and rejuvenation to the image.

Overall, the image presents a cozy and inviting workspace, with a focus on creativity and productivity. The use of a notebook, scissors, and glass of water suggests a person who values their work and is willing to put in the effort to create something meaningful.

nodes.plm_action: Opening a scrapbook page and turning the pages
nodes.plm_caption: An overhead view of two hands opening a scrapbook that is open to a page. The person has written on the page and there are ticket stubs and receipts in the pages on the left. The scrapbook is on a white work table with scissors, a blue tape dispenser and a small white and black tool next to the scrapbook.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a person engaged in crafting or scrapbooking, surrounded by various materials and tools on a white table. The individual is holding a book or binder open to a page filled with papers, stickers, and other embellishments, with their hands visible at the bottom of the frame.

**Key Elements:**

* **Book or Binder:** The central object in the image, containing papers, stickers, and other embellishments.
* **Hands:** The person's hands are visible at the bottom of the frame, holding the book or binder open.
* **Table:** The background of the image, featuring a white surface with various materials and tools scattered around.
* **Materials and Tools:** Several items are visible on the table, including a pair of scissors, a glass jar, and a black and white object that resembles a camera or other device.

**Overall Impression:**

The image conveys a sense of creativity and productivity, with the person engaged in a hobby or activity that involves crafting or scrapbooking. nodes.plm_action: Writing name in cursive in an art journal
nodes.plm_caption:
A close-up shot of a scrapbook lies on a desk, surrounded by other office supplies. A woman reaches to the scrapbook with one arm and holds a pen, while also using the other arm to adjust a strip of tape. She flips the strip of tape over, writes on the scrapbook and flips it back down.
The woman holds the pen at a slight angle, using the thumb and index finger to grip the pen. She holds the scrapbook with her other hand, gently grasping the corner edge with the pad of her thumb and index finger.
It's worth noting that the close-up shot can make the woman's hands look quite large.

Around the scrapbook are typical stationery items—scissors, a glass of water, a tape dispenser, a ticket stub and other paper scraps—visible on the clean surface.

nodes.plm_action: Writing in cursive script on a grid patterned paper

nodes.llama3_caption:
The image presents a close-up view of a journal or scrapbook, showcasing a collage of various materials and objects. The purpose of the image appears to be artistic expression or documentation of personal thoughts and experiences.

Here are the key elements in the image:

* A piece of paper with a brown floral pattern:
	+ The paper is rectangular in shape
	+ It features a repeating pattern of flowers and leaves in a light brown color
	+ The pattern is intricate and detailed, suggesting a high level of craftsmanship
* A piece of paper with a pink and white marbled design:
	+ The paper has a unique, swirly pattern that resembles marble
	+ The pink and white colors are blended together in a way that creates a sense of movement and energy
	+ The design is eye-catching and adds visual interest to the collage
* A piece of paper with a tan background and black writing:
	+ The paper is rectangular in shape and has a solid tan background
	+ The black writing is illegible, but it appears to be a quote or phrase
	+ The contrast between the tan background and black writing creates a sense of depth and dimensionality

Overall, the image showcases a creative and expressive use of materials and objects to convey a personal message or theme. The combination of patterns, colors, and textures creates a visually appealing and thought-provoking piece of art.

nodes.llama3_caption:

* The word "me" is written in large, bold black text:

	+ The text is centered in the image, with equal spacing on either side.
	+ The letters are all uppercase, which adds to the bold and attention-grabbing effect.
* The background of the image is a bright yellow color:

Overall, the image is a striking and eye-catching design that effectively communicates the message "me" in a bold and attention-grabbing way. The use of a bright yellow background and bold black text creates a high-contrast visual effect that draws the viewer's attention.

They are putting the pieces into a black book that is open. The background is a white table. The video is sped up to show how quick this process is.

summary.brief: Hands quickly cut paper strips and add them to an open journal.
summary.detailed: The shot shows a white tabletop with an open black journal, a blue tape dispenser, and a glass of water. A pair of scissors is lifted and used to trim thin strips of paper. After each cut, the hand places the fresh strip onto the journal page, where a ticket stub and a small Polaroid photo are already glued. Small pieces of blue tape are applied to secure the new paper pieces. The hands continue cutting and arranging additional strips in a rapid, sped‑up sequence until the segment ends.

action.detailed: Pick up the scissors, cut the paper into strips, then press each cut strip onto the open journal page, securing it with a bit of blue tape as needed.

nodes.plm_action: Adding paper strips to pages
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a man preparing his art journal or scrapbook. He is pasting items in his book and cutting pieces with a pair of scissors. The background is a plain white surface with a bottle of water and the book.

summary.brief: Hands tape a ticket onto an open journal page and trim its edge with scissors.
summary.detailed: An overhead view shows a white tabletop with an open journal lying flat. A ticket is positioned on the left‑hand page, and a strip of permanent tape from a blue dispenser is pressed onto it to secure it. The creator then lifts a pair of black scissors from the bottom‑left corner and, in a quick motion, cuts a small portion of the taped ticket to create a neat edge. A glass of water remains visible in the background throughout the brief sequence.

action.detailed: Using black scissors, cut a small piece of the taped ticket on the journal page while keeping the rest held down with tape.

nodes.plm_action: Using washi paper to create collage pages
nodes.plm_caption:
An individual opens a notebook and sticks small rectangular shapes of brown paper onto the pages. While adding paper, he glues it down with a blue glue tool, and then switches to a transparent glue. In the background is a white surface with a glass of water, a small black scissor, a blue glue tool, a rectangular-shaped ticket, a paper cut out, and a brown paper pack. 
At the 12-second mark, the blue glue tool is removed, and the individual moves to add two more small rectangles of brown paper to the notebook.

summary.brief: Hands add a ticket and brown paper rectangles to an open journal, securing them with blue tape and clear adhesive.
summary.detailed: An open journal rests on a white tabletop surrounded by a glass of water, black scissors, a blue tape dispenser, a ticket stub, a paper cut‑out and a pack of brown paper. The creator first positions the ticket on the pages and straightens it with tweezers, then places several thin rectangular pieces of brown paper onto the left and right pages. The first pieces are tacked down with blue permanent tape from the dispenser; the tool is then set aside and a clear adhesive tape is applied to secure two additional brown rectangles, ending with a larger clear tape strip placed on both sides of another brown strip to bond it to the journal.

action.detailed: Place a ticket and several brown paper rectangles onto the open journal pages, first securing them with blue tape from the dispenser and then reinforcing them with clear adhesive tape.

nodes.plm_action: Applies a thin layer of transparent glue to the back of the paper strip using a small brush
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a person's hands as they put a small piece of brown tape on a journal. The person moves their hands quickly.
The person is sitting at a white work surface. There is a open journal, there are different brown paper cut outs around the journal, along with a pair of scissors and a blue tape dispenser. There is also a small glass of water in the top left corner.

summary.brief: The creator’s hands press a thin light‑brown tape strip onto the journal edge and then rearrange nearby supplies.
summary.detailed: On a white desk, the hands place a thin light‑brown tape strip onto the edge of an open journal page, holding the page down with the other hand to secure it. After the tape is applied, they move a ticket from a right‑hand pile to a left‑hand pile, reach for the black scissors, pull the blue tape dispenser closer, and finally pick up a white, flexible rectangular sheet of paper.

action.detailed: Place a thin light‑brown tape strip onto the edge of the open journal page, press it down with the other hand, then move the ticket to the left, pick up the scissors, shift the blue tape dispenser nearer, and grasp the white flexible rectangle of paper.

nodes.plm_action: Apply washi tape to paper in crisscross pattern
nodes.plm_caption: The video features an overhead shot of a person applying a length of tape to a small strip of paper in front of an open book. They are using a blue mini tape dispenser and are seated on the right-hand side of the shot. There are some ticket stubs to the right of the open book, a pair of scissors and a glass of water. The room is white. The lighting is natural and the shot is well-lit.

summary.brief: A hand applies a strip of double‑sided tape to a piece of paper on an open journal spread.
summary.detailed: From a top‑down view, an open black‑covered journal lies on a white table with a white sheet of paper positioned in front of the page. The creator pulls a long strip of double‑sided tape from a small blue tape dispenser, places the tape onto the paper, and rubs it repeatedly with a fingertip from top to bottom to activate the adhesive. After pressing, the hand lifts the paper to show the newly adhered tape. Around the workspace a pair of scissors, a ticket stub, and a clear jar of water are visible, and the journal page contains dense, unreadable black lettering.

action.detailed: Peel a strip of double‑sided tape from the blue dispenser, lay it onto the white paper on the open journal page, rub the tape with a fingertip from top to bottom to secure it, and lift the paper to check the adhesion.

nodes.plm_action: Applying a straight strip of double-sided adhesive tape onto the page
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person adding decorative strips to a notebook's page.

summary.brief: Hands place a wooden stick on a ticket, arrange paper strips, apply glue and tape, and flip a cut‑out strip to reveal a pink underside.
summary.detailed: The creator lifts a small rectangular wooden stick and sets it onto a ticket, then picks up a black paper strip and positions it on the work surface. They spread glue on the back of a rectangular paper piece, flip it over, dab hot‑glue on one end, flip it back and set the glue gun aside. Next, clear tape from a blue dispenser is pressed onto a long paper strip, and blue tape is applied to a brown piece of paper. Finally, a white notebook strip with cut‑out shapes is lifted, turned over, and its hidden pink side is shown.

action.detailed: Apply glue to the back of the paper strip, press it onto the journal page, secure it with clear tape, add a dab of hot‑glue to the end, then flip the strip to reveal its pink underside.

nodes.plm_action: Gluing page corners to a different page
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a person creating a book page collage art. The person uses white and black color papers and a white binding paper. The person uses both a pair of black scissors and white tape to apply the paper. The person creates about three art pages in the book. The video takes place on a white desk with a book opened, with various craft supplies visible. A glass of water is also on the desk. The video is shown in fast motion.

summary.brief: The creator tapes, trims, and adds a translucent sheet to an open journal page.
summary.detailed: In fast‑motion, the maker first places a thin horizontal strip of tape across the center of an opened journal spread. A rectangular white piece of paper is positioned over the tape and pressed down. Using scissors held in the right hand, the excess edges of the white paper are trimmed on the right and left sides, and the paper is lifted and readjusted as needed. After the paper is secured, a translucent vellum (white translucent paper) is laid on top of the composition and smoothed into place. The clip ends with a static view of the finished page alongside a tape dispenser, a ticket stub, scissors and a glass of water on the white desk.

action.detailed: Apply a horizontal tape strip to the center of an open journal page, lay a white rectangular paper onto the tape, cut away the excess edges with scissors, then place a translucent vellum sheet over the assembly and smooth it into place.

nodes.plm_action: Roughening up the corners of the book's pages with an exacto knife
nodes.plm_caption: In this video we see someone making a handmade journal. The title of the journal is "verdad". There are many pieces of tape stuck on the journal and the person is adding some more tape in order to close the journal. Their fingers are also used to press down and smooth the tape. They are working on a white flat surface, next to the journal there is a pair of scissors, a small container with a dark liquid in it, and a blue tape dispenser. There is also a ticket on the side of the journal. The person is wearing a ring on their right hand.

summary.brief: Hands seal a handmade journal titled “verdad” with tape and a clear plastic overlay.
summary.detailed: The creator’s hands work on a brown‑covered journal that shows the title “verdad” on a white tabletop. First, thin layers of tan, brown and white paper are added to the front cover, starting with a brown banner, followed by brown squares and a white rectangle. Clear cellophane‑like tape is then peeled from the pages, pressed tightly and smoothed with the fingertips, while a pair of black‑handled scissors trims excess tape. A small white strip from a blue tape dispenser is applied to the top corner, and two horizontal tape strips are placed across the open pages to create a window effect, each pressed down to adhere. The hands hold a piece of paper in place while removing tape from the side of the cover, then apply tape to the notebook’s top edge. A clear plastic sheet is attached to the front pages, with several pages sticking out, and the sheet’s edges are adjusted by pulling and sliding the fingers. Near the journal sit a ticket, a small dark‑ink container, a glass jar, the blue tape dispenser, and a ring is visible on the right hand.

action.detailed: Peel off clear tape, press and smooth it onto the journal’s pages, cut any excess with scissors, apply a new strip from the blue dispenser to the top corner, and adjust the clear plastic overlay to close the cover.
action.actor: The creator’s hands (wearing a ring on the right hand)

nodes.plm_action: Glue cover page to book cover with small piece of tape
nodes.plm_caption: The video features a person preparing a handmade book, with a page opened. The book is placed on top of white surface with other small craft objects around. The person shows off the completed page. The entire setting is covered in white, so the video is quite bright and in good light.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a flat lay of various items on a white surface, with the title "Finca el Vergel" prominently displayed in large black text on a gray rectangle. The purpose of the image appears to be showcasing a collection of objects, possibly for creative or artistic purposes.

Here are the details of each item in the image:

* A book with a gray cover and the words "Finca el Vergel" in large black text:

	+ The scissors are placed on the left side of the image, near the bottom.

* A blue object that resembles a small container or lid:
	+ The object is located at the bottom-right corner of the image.
	+ It has a rounded shape and a small handle on top.
* A glass of water with ice cubes:
	+ The glass is placed in the top-left corner of the image.
	+ It contains a few ice cubes and what appears to be water.

Overall, the image presents a curated selection of objects, possibly related to a creative project or hobby. The inclusion of a book, scissors, and a glass of water suggests a focus on writing, crafting, or other activities that require these items.

nodes.plm_action: Removing staples from the back page
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows two hands opening a book that has been covered in cellophane with text on it. It is opened from right to left. The book is on a white surface with a glass mason jar, black scissors, a piece of paper, a tape dispenser and two receipts next to it.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image shows a person's hands holding a book or magazine open to a page with the word "Find" on it, surrounded by various objects on a white table. The purpose of the image is unclear, but it may be a still from a video or a photograph taken for artistic or creative purposes.

* A book or magazine:
	+ The book or magazine is open to a page with the word "Find" in large letters.
	+ The page has a collage of images and text, including what appears to be a ticket stub or receipt.
	+ The book or magazine is held by two hands, one on either side of the page.
* Scissors:
	+ A pair of scissors is placed on the left side of the table, near the bottom of the image.
	+ The scissors are black and have a circular handle.
* A glass of water:
	+ A glass of water is placed in the top-left corner of the image.
	+ The glass is clear and filled with ice cubes.

Overall, the image suggests that the person is engaged in some kind of creative activity, possibly related to art or design. The presence of scissors and a glass of water implies that the person may be working on a project that requires precision and focus.

nodes.plm_action: Applying glue to attach ticket stub to journal page
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a person holding up a cut magazine page before applying tape to the upper and lower ends. They carefully tap the tape once with a ruler and push it across the ends of the pages.
The video begins with a left hand holding the top left side of the cut magazine page. It then quickly releases its hold before reaching towards a blue clear tape dispenser on the work surface. Once the fingers have closed around the end of the tape, the fingers curl around the body and position the hand above the tape dispenser. The blue tape is pulled back, and pressed onto the upper left side of the paper page. The person repositions the hand to press the tape onto the other end of the page, which is below the hand. The hand is set back down on the other side of the paper and pushed towards the top left corner of the work surface. It pulls back on the tape dispenser and taps the end once with the ruler. The tape dispenser is set back down on the work surface as the hand removes the tape and slides it out of the dispenser. The person sets the magazine page at the lower edge of the paper with their left hand and picks up the tape dispenser again. The blue tape dispenser is brought to the back corner of the magazine page, tape is pressed onto the left edge and pulled back again before being pressed onto the right edge. The tape dispenser is set back down on the work surface as the person releases the tape.

summary.brief: The person tapes the edges of a cut magazine page using a blue dispenser and a ruler.
summary.detailed: In a close‑up view of a white work surface, the left hand holds a cut magazine page while the right hand pulls a strip of blue transparent tape from a dispenser and presses it onto the top edge of the page. The hand then moves to the opposite (bottom) edge and applies another strip of tape, after which a ruler is tapped against the freshly laid tape to secure it. The dispenser is lifted again and tape is pressed onto the left side of the page, then onto the right side, smoothing each strip as it goes. Nearby stationery items such as scissors, a glass of water, a ticket and other paper scraps are visible.

action.detailed: Pull a strip of blue tape from the dispenser, press it onto the top edge of the cut magazine page, repeat on the bottom edge, tap the tape with a ruler, then press tape onto the left and right edges, smoothing each strip into place.

nodes.plm_action: nail down or stick together
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a close-up of a person’s hands as they apply adhesive tape to a small printed page. The tape dispenser is blue and the adhesive strip is thin, the person places it on the paper at the bottom. The page is in landscape orientation, and the tape dispenser is about two inches off the edge of the page. The tape dispenser is applied from left to right. The page has a black-and-white picture in the top-left corner. The person holds the tape dispenser with the index finger on the back and the thumb at the front of the dispenser. The person also holds the paper with the thumb on the back and the index, middle, and ring fingers on the top of the paper. The background is a white table and there are other objects present, including a closed black book, a clear mason jar, and a small ticket stub in the corner of the frame.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image shows a person holding a brochure with their hands, surrounded by various items on a white table. The purpose of the image is to showcase the brochure and its contents.

* A person is holding a brochure with their hands:
	+ The person's hands are visible, holding the brochure in front of them.
	+ The brochure appears to be made of paper or cardboard.
* The brochure has text and images on it:
	+ The text is written in a clear, easy-to-read font.
	+ The images are likely related to the content of the brochure.
* There are other objects on the table around the brochure:
	+ A glass jar with a lid is visible in the top-left corner of the image.
	+ A black pen or pencil is placed next to the jar.
	+ A small piece of paper or card is attached to the wall behind the table.

Overall, the image suggests that the person is preparing to read or study the brochure, and the surrounding objects may be related to the content of the brochure.

nodes.plm_action: Put sticky note over the notebook to avoid ink bleeding through
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a person placing a sticker on a notebook. The sticker has many words printed on it, the words are in Spanish. The person uses a clear piece of tape to secure the sticker on the notebook. At the end of the video, the person places their hand over the tape before lifting it and letting it peel away. The video ends with the person holding the notebook open while turning the page.

summary.brief: A Spanish‑text sticker is placed on an open journal page, clear tape is applied and peeled away, and the notebook is turned to the next page.
summary.detailed: The creator’s hands position a white sticker printed with Spanish words onto an open journal page, lay a strip of clear adhesive tape over the sticker and press it to secure the paper, then lift the tape away so the sticker remains glued, and finally hold the notebook open while turning to the next page.

action.detailed: Press clear tape onto the printed Spanish‑text sticker on the journal page, smooth it, peel the tape off to leave the sticker adhered, and turn the page.

nodes.plm_action: Opening the book to showcase its contents
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows hands opening a book that has white pages.  Both hands are on either side of the pages and they are on a white table. Then the hands pick up a pair of black scissors in their right hand.  The thumb is in one handle hole and the next three fingers are in the other hole.  The scissors are behind the book.  The left hand picks a plain white piece of paper up from the right side of the book and places it on top of the book cover.  The scissors are in the background.  The left hand repositions a clear plastic pocket protector piece of paper that is in the center of the left page and places a brown paper card underneath.  The background is a plain white surface.

summary.brief: The maker opens the journal, lifts scissors, places a white sheet on the cover, and slides a brown card under a clear pocket protector.
summary.detailed: On a plain white table, the journal is opened with both hands on either side of the white pages. The right hand reaches behind the book to pick up a pair of black scissors, positioning the thumb in one handle and the next three fingers in the other. The left hand lifts a plain white sheet from the right side of the spread and sets it on the book cover. It then moves a clear plastic pocket‑protector that sits in the centre of the left page and slides a brown paper card underneath it. The scissors remain in the background while the hands continue to arrange these elements.

action.detailed: Open the journal, pick up the scissors, place the white sheet on the cover, reposition the clear pocket protector, and slide the brown card underneath it.

nodes.plm_action: Flipping through pages of a journal or book
nodes.plm_caption:
This video features a person opening a black-covered book with two blank white pages, from its middle page to the right page and then back to the left page.
The person holds the right corner of the right white page with the left thumb and index finger. Then the left thumb and index finger take hold of the right corner and push it out of the book. Then the left thumb presses down on the page and the index and middle fingers are used to grab it from the left corner. Then the page is lifted up out of the book.

summary.brief: The creator flips through a blank journal on a white desk.
summary.detailed: A black‑covered journal lies on a white tabletop surrounded by a blue tape dispenser, a ticket or receipt, and a small glass jar. The hands lift the right‑hand page by holding its right corner with the left thumb and index finger, push the page outward, press it down, then grasp the left corner with thumb, index and middle fingers and lift it to turn the page. The page is flipped back and forth several times, and the notebook is finally rotated toward the camera.

action.detailed: Flip the journal page by holding its right corner with the left thumb and index finger, pushing it outward, pressing it down, then grabbing the left corner with thumb, index and middle fingers and lifting it to turn the page.

nodes.plm_action: Opening the notebook to the blank page
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person preparing to write in a small pad. The pad has white pages in it. The hand is opening the book on the right-hand side with an art pencil in the hand. A bright light is in front of the pad, brightening it up. There is a bottle of cleaner to the left and blue tape on the right. The desk is white. The person drops the pad near the left side of the desk. The hand moves back to the right to pick up the pad, turns it upright with the pages facing the camera, and then sets it down again.

nodes.plm_action: Cutting out the page protector
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows someone opening up a notebook and using black scissors to cut the binding. The video shows the process in slow motion. There are some cards on the notebook, they are brown with a small pink snippet.

summary.brief: Hands trim the left edge of an open notebook page with black scissors.
summary.detailed: A notebook is opened on a white desk surrounded by brown cards, a glass cup, a candle jar, ticket stubs and a blue marker. One hand steadies the book while the other lifts black scissors. In slow motion the scissors slice away the left side of the open page, cutting roughly a quarter of the way down from the top. After the cut the pages are flipped as the scissors remain placed beside the book, all captured from a top‑down view.

action.detailed: Cut off the left edge of the open notebook page with black scissors while holding the book steady.

nodes.plm_action: Folding the paper in half and cutting around the folded line
nodes.plm_caption: A person is cutting out pieces of the middle of a sheet of paper. The person then places the sheet of paper into a notebook, which contains other sheets of paper, some of which have words on them. The paper they are cutting out from the sheet of paper is brown with white flowers. The notebook is black. The desk is white.

summary.brief: The maker trims a brown floral sheet and adds the cut pieces to an open black journal.
summary.detailed: From an overhead view of a white desk, the creator’s left hand (wearing a wedding ring) holds down a brown sheet printed with white flowers on an open black notebook. The right hand uses scissors to cut out several shapes from the middle of the sheet, moving the paper as needed. After each cut, the small pieces are placed onto the notebook page. A ticket stub, a clear glass, and a blue object remain visible in the background throughout the ten‑second segment.

action.detailed: Hold the brown floral sheet with the left hand, cut sections from its middle with scissors in the right hand, and place the cut pieces onto the open black journal page.

nodes.plm_action: Applying tape to attach the inside of the page to the outside page
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a pair of hands preparing a scrapbook page. The book has different cut-outs and cut-ups on it with a lot of adhesive tape. The hands are cutting some clear tape, and then the tape is shown on the scrapbook page. The pages of the scrapbook are black, and the cover is not visible. On the table that the book is on, you can see a pair of black scissors, a blue tape dispenser, a ticket stub, a jar, and a white piece of paper with writing on it.

summary.brief: The crafter cuts a paper strip, tapes it, and adheres it to the centre of a black scrapbook page.
summary.detailed: The hands turn to a new page of the black journal, cut a small word‑cutout that reads “Finca,” then cut a length of clear tape from the blue dispenser. The tape is placed over the cut‑out, the taped piece is lifted, briefly folded, and positioned in the centre of the spread. The right hand presses the taped paper onto the page while the left hand steadies the journal. A ticket stub, a glass of water, black scissors and the tape dispenser remain visible on the white tabletop throughout the clip.

action.detailed: Cut a small piece of paper, cut a length of clear tape, place the tape over the paper, lift the taped piece, and press it onto the scrapbook page.

nodes.plm_action: Adding a double-sided tape to the notebook page
nodes.plm_caption: The video features an open journal surrounded by crafting and writing tools. It then cuts away to a still shot before continuing to show hands holding a black pen.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a collection of objects arranged on a white surface, likely a desk or table. The objects are:

* A pair of scissors with a blue handle and a black blade, positioned to the right of the image.
* A ruler, placed to the right of the scissors, with a white body and black markings.
* A book or magazine, featuring a cover with the word "Finca" printed in large letters, positioned in the center of the image.
* A glass of water, located in the top-left corner of the image.
* A small piece of paper or card, partially visible in the bottom-left corner of the image.

The overall atmosphere of the image suggests a workspace or study area, with the objects arranged in a deliberate and organized manner. The presence of the scissors, ruler, and book/magazine implies that the person using this space is engaged in some form of creative or intellectual activity.

nodes.plm_action: Writing name "Seth" in cursive on a page
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a pair of hands holding a pen and writing inside a book with decorative paper and tape. The video is in stop-motion, so it appears that the person is writing quickly. The background is white, there is a pair of scissors, a ticket, a blue measuring tape, and a glass of water visible on the table next to the person's hand. The book has a lot of white lettering on the pages, and the page the person is writing on has "sater" written on the left side in black marker, and "fincs" on the page on the right. The person places a picture over the place where they are writing and pushes it down to the page. Then they start writing with cursive, writing "sater " on the left side, then lifts the picture and writes the right side. Then they write both sides at the same time. Then they lift the picture and write "sater" on the right side, then on the left side, then in the middle of the page, and at the top of the page. Then they turn the page over.  There are more pictures taped over the page after this. There is a pen in the person's right hand. The background is white, there is a pair of scissors, a ticket, a blue measuring tape, and a glass of water visible on the table next to the person's hand. The video is in stop-motion, so it appears that the person is writing quickly.

summary.brief: Hands write cursive text on a journal spread while using a picture overlay.
summary.detailed: In a stop‑motion clip, the creator’s right hand holds a pen and writes cursive lettering on an open journal page that already has black‑marker headings on each side. A small picture is placed over the writing area and pressed down; the picture is lifted repeatedly as the writer adds words on the left side, then on the right side, then on both sides together, and finally across the middle and top of the page. After the lettering is finished, the page is turned over and additional pictures are taped onto the new side. The white desk surface also shows scissors, a concert ticket, a blue measuring‑tape and a glass of water.

action.brief: Write cursive text on journal page
action.detailed: Hold the pen in the right hand, place a picture over the page and press it down, write a word on the left side, lift the picture, write on the right side, write on both sides together, lift again and add more lettering across the middle and top, then turn the page and tape more pictures.

nodes.plm_action: Writing in pen to create journal entry
nodes.plm_caption: In this video, a pair of hands places a piece of tape across a page in a scrapbook and writes on the tape with a pen.  The page is mostly covered with letters and appears to be from a book with a black cover.  In the background, a pair of scissors and a small tape dispenser can be seen.  There is also a sheet of a movie ticket to the side of the book.  On the left corner of the screen is a glass.

summary.brief: Hands apply a strip of tape to a scrapbook page and write the word “day” on it.
summary.detailed: The creator steadies a page ripped from a black‑covered book on a clear plastic surface, places a thin strip of clear tape across the page, and then uses a brush‑pen to write the word “day” onto the taped area. The left hand holds the paper in place while the right hand writes. In the background a pair of scissors, a small blue‑handed tape dispenser, a small movie‑ticket scrap, and a glass of water are visible.

action.detailed: Place a strip of clear tape across the open page, hold the page steady with the left hand, and use a brush‑pen to write the word “day” on the taped surface.

nodes.plm_action: Applying tape to the page and securing the label with a pen mark
nodes.plm_caption:
The video starts with the bottom half of a transparent sheet over a black notebook containing sheets of paper with black and red writing. The top half of the transparent sheet has a white rectangle on the top layer. The person's left hand is holding the left edge of the transparent sheet. The person's index finger is positioned on the paper below the transparent sheet. They press down the transparent sheet onto the paper, they take a blue marker pen and write in it 2-3 times. They hold the sheet with the left hand and lift the right hand away from it. Their left-hand lifts the paper, the pen is held in their right hand. The rest of their right fingers lift the sheet.
The video is set against a white background. A glass container, scissors, a transparent sheet, a pen, and a transparent ticket are on the table at the beginning and end of the video.

summary.brief: The person writes on a clear overlay placed over a journal page and then adds a sticker to a brown paper piece.
summary.detailed: From a top‑down view a clear sheet covers the lower half of an open black notebook page that already has black and red markings. The left hand holds the left edge of the sheet while the right hand picks up a blue marker and presses the sheet onto the paper, drawing two or three short blue strokes on the transparent overlay. After the pen is set down, the left hand lifts the sheet, and the right hand peels a small piece of paper from the surface. A black‑ink pen is then used to write on the translucent paper, and finally a letter‑sticker is placed onto a dark brown piece of paper that has other transparent stickers on it. The whole action occurs on a white tabletop surrounded by a glass, scissors, tape dispensers and other craft supplies.

action.detailed: Press the clear sheet onto the notebook page, make several blue ink marks with the marker, lift the sheet, peel a small piece of paper, and then write with a black pen before sticking a letter sticker onto a brown surface.

nodes.plm_action: Adding more stickers to the page

nodes.plm_action: Gently place receipt sticker at the top right corner of the page

This video features a pair of hands interacting with two tickets and a book in front of them. The tickets and books are placed on a flat surface. In the background we can see scissors, a tape dispenser and a glass with water in it. The hands are in focus in this video and have no background. A man's hands are visible.
The hands interact with a ticket. They hold the ticket down on a book with the finger of the left hand, while the thumb and index finger of the right hand grip the ticket and smooth it down on the book. Then they pick it up, placing their finger on the bottom and thumb on the top. Then they place it back on the book and smooth down. The hand moves away from the paper. Then it returns and again smooths down the paper. The book lifts slightly up, and the ticket moves. The hands then use two fingers to smooth down the ticket.
The video is in fast motion.

summary.brief: Hands attach and trim a concert ticket onto a scrapbook page.
summary.detailed: The creator peels off the ticket’s backing while steadily holding the journal page with the left hand. The ticket is placed on the open page and pressed down with the right thumb and index finger, with a left‑hand finger supporting the paper underneath. The ticket is lifted, repositioned and smoothed again several times, causing the page to lift slightly. Two fingers then smooth the ticket flat. Double‑sided tape is applied to the back of the ticket, it is pressed onto the page, and scissors trim any excess around it. The hands briefly hover over the page as if preparing to write.

action.detailed: Press the ticket onto the journal page, smooth it flat with your fingers, apply double‑sided tape to its back, and trim the surrounding paper with scissors.

nodes.plm_action: Removing tape from the back of paper

nodes.plm_action: attach small ticket to page

A folded receipt is then picked up, a dab of glue is applied to its back and it is pressed onto the page; the same step is repeated with a second receipt. Next, a small piece of paper that reads “day” is lifted and attached to another part of the spread with double‑sided tape. Finally, the creator switches to a hot‑glue gun, holds it over a light‑brown page that has black writing and a white rectangle, and draws a line of hot glue along a strip of paper. Throughout the segment a glass of water, a glass mug, black scissors and the blue tape dispenser remain on the white tabletop, and the creator is wearing blue denim shorts.

action.detailed: Apply clear tape to the ticket stub and press it onto the journal page, dab glue on each folded receipt and glue them onto the page, use double‑sided tape to affix the “day” paper, and run hot‑glue along a paper strip on the next page.

summary.brief: An open planner spread shows a September 10 ticket surrounded by stationery on a white desk.
summary.detailed: The camera is fixed on a white tabletop where an open planner lies open to a two‑page spread. The left page is headed “Saturday” and contains handwritten notes, stickers and a small “fine” label under a ticket‑like piece of paper. The right page is headed “Monday, September 10” (also shown as “Montag”) and has a ticket stub affixed, held in place by a gold binder clip that spans the two pages. Around the planner are assorted supplies: a pair of black‑handle scissors to the left, a white pen on the right, a black‑and‑silver pen and several binder clips nearby, a black notebook positioned behind the spread, a pen holder with a glass of water on a coaster in the upper‑left corner, and a red square container with a silver knob. A fingertip briefly appears on the right side of the frame, but no person moves and the scene remains static.

nodes.llama3_caption:
This image presents a close-up view of a scrapbook page, showcasing a harmonious blend of brown and white hues.

The dominant feature of the page is a large, brown rectangle adorned with a delicate floral pattern, situated at the top. A white strip of paper, bearing the inspirational quote "Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times if one only remembers to turn on the light," is superimposed over the rectangle. Below the quote, a small, black-and-white photograph is positioned, accompanied by a tan rectangle featuring a black, cursive word. The page is surrounded by a white border, and a gold object is visible on the left side of the image, although its exact nature is unclear.
