nodes.plm_action: Remove pages from journal and create separate pages for stickers
nodes.plm_caption:
A bright yellow graphic with black bold text that reads "me". A person pulls a journal from behind a "me" sticker and takes off the clear protective cover on the inside. The person places the journal on the table and opens it to two blank pages. They grab a few pieces of cardstock and place them in the left corner of the journal. They cut the cardstock to fit in the page on the left and place a big brown label above the cardstock.  They place a small notepad with many words on the right side of the journal. They cut another brown piece to fit the space to the left of the journal. They slide it in place and close the journal. A new sticker with text on it is placed on the corner of the journal.
The person's hands are the main focus of the video. The journal and papers are on a white table that is out of focus.
 bright yellow with black bold text, and multiple pieces of cardstock.

summary.brief: Hands open a journal and layer trimmed paper and cardstock onto its pages.
summary.detailed: The clip begins with a bright yellow “me” graphic over a black‑covered journal. A hand pulls the black string clasp, removes the cover and sets the journal on a white tabletop, opening it to two blank pages. The creator then selects several sheets—a cream‑colored paper with writing, a brown strip, a vertical gray‑text strip, and various cardstock pieces. The cream sheet is placed on the left page, the brown strip is positioned partially over it, and the vertical strip is added at the top left corner. A rectangular cardstock with a floral design is trimmed and taped onto the left page. Additional brown and tan pieces are lifted from the edge of the book and arranged on the spread, while a light‑beige sheet with small letters rests on the right page. The hands briefly tear some pieces, reposition them, add a new sticker to the corner, and finish by placing a final brown rectangular piece. The journal is then closed.

action.detailed: Open the journal, trim and position the various paper and cardstock pieces onto the pages, add a sticker, adjust or remove pieces as needed, and then close the journal.

nodes.plm_action: Applying glue to a paper label
nodes.plm_caption: This video shows a hand of an individual, cutting and pasting images into an art journal or scrapbook. The video begins with a piece of light tan card stock held up in both hands. A pair of scissors in the right hand are used to cut a small piece of the card stock. The cut piece of card stock is placed onto the cover of the art journal on the far left page. As the video progresses, a larger piece of card stock is cut and pasted onto the journal in the center of the left page. The entire finished piece of the journal on the table is seen and picked up.

summary.brief: Hands cut paper pieces, arrange them on a journal page, affix a ticket and a thin strip, then lift the finished spread.
summary.detailed: The camera shows a pair of hands working over a white tabletop. First, a light‑tan cardstock is held and cut with black‑handled scissors into a small strip, and a larger piece of brown decorative paper is cut as well; these cut pieces are placed onto the left page of an opened brown journal, together with an off‑white sheet that bears printed text and a cream‑coloured spot. After the collage is arranged, a small ticket is positioned on the paper, a thin white strip is laid over the ticket and gently pressed with a finger to secure it, and then the ticket is lifted away, leaving the strip in place. The completed journal spread is finally lifted off the surface.

action.detailed: Cut the cardstock and decorative paper, attach the pieces to the left page of the journal, place a ticket on the paper, lay a thin white strip over the ticket and press it into place, then lift the finished spread.

nodes.plm_action: selecting paper size or type
nodes.plm_caption: In an open notebook with blank pages with a binder clip on it. With a black object and some papers appearing from the left frame to the right frame. One paper has a collage photo, there is also a receipt visible in the top frame.

summary.brief: A hand cuts a collage sheet placed on an open journal.
summary.detailed: The camera shows a top‑down view of an open notebook with a dark brown cover, blank white pages and a metal binder clip on the right edge. Around it lie a pair of black‑handled scissors, a receipt/ticket, a business card, a round magnet, a small brown piece of paper, a black rectangular object with a white label, and a pen held between three fingers. A hand enters from the left, lifts the scissors, positions them over a central sheet of paper that displays nine small pictures, slices through the sheet, and then removes the scissors, leaving the cut collage among the other items.

action.detailed: The hand picks up the black scissors, places them on the collage sheet on the open journal, slices through the paper, and lifts the scissors away.

nodes.plm_action: Flip through pages of a book, showcasing different layouts and designs.
nodes.plm_caption: The person is turning the pages of a book and placing it on the desk next to an open journal. The book has many words on the pages. The journal is white on the inside and brown on the outside. The clip on the journal is green. There is a black object on the left of the journal.

summary.brief: A hand slides a sheet of paper and flips through the pages of a book while an open brown journal with a metal clip rests on a white desk.
summary.detailed: The shot begins with a brown leather journal opened to blank white pages on a white tabletop, held open by a metal clip on its right side. A black tablet, a small rectangular ticket or receipt, and a loose sheet of paper are visible nearby. The paper drifts slowly from the bottom left toward the center of the frame. Then a hand appears, grasping a book that is also held open with a binder clip; the hand rapidly turns its pages, revealing text and a collage of small images. After the quick page‑flipping, the book is positioned beside the journal, and the surrounding items remain in place.

action.detailed: The creator's hand flips through the pages of the open book quickly while it is held by a binder clip, then moves the book to rest next to the open journal.

nodes.plm_action: Cutting paper with scissors along a straight lin
nodes.plm_caption: This video shows a person cutting out a magazine page with a pair of scissors. A hand is visible. The white work surface has a book lying on it, and another hand is visible putting it on the right of the book.

nodes.plm_action: Cut photo from book using scissors

The magazine page is held open by the left hand and contains a lot of small photographs that make up a larger picture. There is some text visible on the side of the page that is facing away from the camera.
nodes.llama3_caption:
This image depicts a person engaged in cutting a book, with their hands holding the scissors and the book open to a page featuring a grid of images.

The book's cover is white, and the page displays a collage of 25 small images arranged in a grid, showcasing various individuals in different poses and attire. The text on the right side of the page is too small to decipher. The person's hands are positioned on the left side of the image, with the scissors cutting the book near the center. The scissors have a black handle and silver blades.

In the background, a white table or surface is visible, with various objects scattered around the book, including a black notebook, a piece of paper, and a roll of tape.

nodes.plm_action: Cut a page from the book
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows an individual removing newspaper clippings and pages from a book.  The individual is seen carefully cutting each clipping into a shape which can be attached onto a binder clip and placed inside the book. The camera view is top down on the book binder and the contents of the binder are shown to be blank, as the person places a new copy of the newspaper inside the book.  The process is completed with placing the binder clip inside the book and showing the result at the end.

summary.brief: A hand cuts a picture from a book, trims it, and adds it together with a printed sheet to an open journal.
summary.detailed: The close‑up shows small black scissors cutting a picture from the back of a book; the cutout is trimmed and positioned onto a blank page of an open journal. Immediately after, the hands lift a folded printed sheet with both hands and lay it on the same spread, turning the journal pages to settle the new pieces.

action.detailed: Cut the picture from the book with scissors, trim its edge, place it onto a blank page of the open journal, then lift the printed sheet with both hands and lay it onto the spread, turning the pages as needed.

nodes.plm_action: Cutting out newspaper clipping for journal
nodes.plm_caption:
A pair of hands place a piece of paper into a book. First the left hand holds the paper down while the right hand cuts a little piece of it with the scissors. Then a series of magazine cutouts are placed onto each side of the open book. Finally, a person picks up a paintbrush and takes a watercolor swatch of pink from the watercolor paint palette and wipes it onto the closed cover of the book.
In the background a black phone, a paint palette, a pair of scissors, a black phonebook and 2 pieces of paper can be seen in the background.
There is also a black book lying on the table.

summary.brief: The maker trims a piece of paper, arranges cut‑out pieces in an open journal, then brushes pink watercolor onto the journal’s cover.
summary.detailed: A pair of hands work over an open leather‑bound journal on a white desk. The left hand holds a sheet of paper in place while the right hand uses scissors to cut a small section from it. After the trim, several paper cut‑outs are positioned on the left‑ and right‑hand pages of the spread. The hands then pick up a paintbrush, dip it in a glass of water, load it with a pink watercolor swatch from a nearby palette, and sweep the pink pigment across the cover as the journal is closed. In the background a black phone, a phone‑book, a paint palette, scissors, a few loose papers and a separate black book can be seen.

action.detailed: Place a trimmed piece of paper into the journal, arrange additional cut‑out pieces on both pages, then dip a brush in water, load it with pink watercolor, and brush the pigment onto the journal’s closed cover.

nodes.plm_action: Dipping brush into pink watercolor paint
nodes.plm_caption:
The video displays a man's hands, using a paintbrush to color the left side of a blank book with a color called rose gold.  They load the brush and start at the left corner, painting 4 different stripes down to the bottom of the page. They then start to add random paint colors to the corner and finish the right stripe at the top of the page.
The left hand stays still and flat on the table with the tips of the fingers only visible and they have the right hand moving back and forth while the fingers wrap around the paintbrush.
On the left hand side of the book the water color palette is also on the table and a clear bottle of water is near the top. At the top right side of the book is a gray sheet of paper with the word "Finca" is visible on the right side of it,  and  a black scissor to the right of it. The table is white.

summary.brief: The artist paints pink‑rose and red watercolor stripes on an open journal page.
summary.detailed: From an overhead view of a white tabletop, the creator holds a small black‑handled watercolor brush in the right hand while the left hand rests flat on the open journal to keep the page steady. First the brush is dipped into a light pink/rose‑gold paint from the palette and four vertical strokes are laid down along the left edge of the page, reaching the bottom. The brush is then lifted, a red paint is selected from the same palette, and a single vertical stripe is added near the top of the right side of the page. Around the work surface sit a watercolor palette with many colors, a clear water bottle, a gray sheet of paper bearing the word "FINCA," and a pair of black scissors.

action.detailed: Dip the brush in pink‑rose watercolor, hold the journal with the left hand, draw four vertical pink‑rose strokes down the left side, then switch to red watercolor and add a vertical stripe at the top of the right side.

nodes.plm_action: Dipping paintbrush into watercolor paint set
nodes.plm_caption:
In this video a person's hands are shown painting inside a book with watercolor paints. The book has a black band at the top and bottom and sits on the table, the left hand holds it on the left of the table as the right hand moves about painting with watercolor paint using a long black paintbrush in a dark green paint palette on the left of the table.
The person moves the paintbrush in quick, rapid, repeated motions. They start with strokes on the left, then move to the right and up and down. The right hand then moves to the right of the frame holding a small amount of paint before coming back to the original position.
At the end, the person again moves the paintbrush around the book but this time painting a vertical line on the left side. They then move the hand back to the watercolor palette on the left.

summary.brief: Hands add quick watercolor strokes to an open, black‑bordered journal.
summary.detailed: The left hand steadies the open journal, which has black bands at the top and bottom, while the right hand holds a black‑handled watercolor brush. The brush is dipped into a palette that displays orange and green watercolor paints on the left side of the table. Rapid, repeated brushstrokes are made across the left side of the page, moving horizontally and vertically. The brush is then lifted, a small dab of paint is picked up from the right side of the palette, and the hand returns to the original position. Finally, a single vertical line is painted along the left edge of the page before the brush is placed back on the palette.

action.detailed: Dip the brush into the palette, then swiftly drag it across the open journal page in multiple directions, add a vertical line on the left side, and return the brush to the palette.
action.actor: The artist’s right hand holding a black‑handled watercolor brush, with the left hand supporting the open journal

nodes.plm_action: Grab the stencil
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a person creating an art journal page. Various art supplies are visible on the table throughout the video. The person is using paint and a paintbrush to create watercolor, using a variety of different watercolors to create a page in the art journal.
The person moves the glass of water and scissors out of the shot. At the end of the video, the person picks up a piece of a textured beige sheet.

summary.brief: A pink watercolor wash appears, then decorative paper pieces are lifted and placed onto the journal spread.
summary.detailed: The hand dips a brush into a glass of water, loads pink watercolor onto the brush and applies a wash to the left side of an open journal page, then sets the water glass and scissors aside. The camera shows the painted surface before the hand flips to the next page. A pink sheet with black lettering is picked up, hovered above the journal and set down, followed by a brown sheet with gold embossing that is lifted, held over the center of the spread, and affixed to the page.

action.detailed: Lift a pink paper with black text, hover it above the open journal, place it down, then lift a brown paper with gold embossing, hover it over the centre of the spread, and affix it to the page.

nodes.plm_action: Apply gold leaf over the edge of watercolor paper
nodes.plm_caption: A person presses down a brown piece of paper onto a white page. They quickly place another piece of brown paper on top, dipping the brush dipped into water onto it and painting down the middle of the white page. They add another brown piece of paper on top.

summary.brief: The creator layers brown paper pieces and paints a vertical yellow watercolor stroke on the journal page.
summary.detailed: First a rectangular brown textured paper is pressed onto the top‑left of the open journal page. A second brown piece is quickly placed on top, then a brush dipped in water is used to draw a straight yellow watercolor line down the centre of the white page. Finally a third brown paper is laid over the painted area.

action.detailed: Press a brown piece onto the top‑left of the open journal page, add a second brown piece on top, dip a brush in water and draw a vertical yellow watercolor stroke down the centre of the white page, then place a third brown paper over the painted area.

nodes.plm_action: Applying glue to the back of the design using a glue stick
nodes.plm_caption: This video features an overhead shot of hands, holding up a strip of brown floral patterned paper and placing it into an open dark journal, on a light-colored surface. The background contains additional art supplies, an open book of drawn paper and a glass jar.

summary.brief: The creator uses a tape dispenser to attach a brown floral‑patterned paper strip to the left page of an open journal and then smooths it with a hand.
summary.detailed: An overhead view shows a white work surface with an open dark‑covered journal, a blue handheld tape dispenser, scissors, jars of water and paint, and assorted paper scraps. The creator pulls the tape dispenser trigger, positions a strip of brown paper printed with gold flowers onto the left page of the spread, and presses it down to secure it. After the strip is adhered, a hand slides across the decorative paper, smoothing the surface, and the shot lingers on the finished spread before fading to black.

action.detailed: Place the brown floral‑patterned paper strip onto the open journal page and press it gently with a tape dispenser to secure it.

nodes.plm_action: Placing ticket into page
nodes.plm_caption: The video captures the hands of a person applying page protectors to some papers in their personal journal as they move in quick sequence, starting with a piece of paper that displays the word "Finca". They then add a white paper protectors covering most of the first page that displays brown and white elements. Their hands then apply a brown ticket as a second page protector to the right, with the bottom edge of the ticket being placed under the white protector on the left side and an additional ticket on the left side that is pinned to the left side of the white protector. Finally, they cut the top left corner of the paper on the left side. The journal rests on a white flat surface next to some additional office supplies and a jar of water.

summary.brief: Hands add page protectors, trim a corner, then remove a page and discard a brown sheet.
summary.detailed: The segment begins with the creator’s hands sliding a paper that shows the word “Finca” onto the left page of an open journal, then covering that page with a white protective sheet that spans most of the brown‑and‑white background. A brown ticket is placed on the right page as a second protector, its lower edge tucked under the white sheet, and another ticket is pinned to the left side of the white sheet. The top‑left corner of the left‑most paper is trimmed with scissors. After this, a hand lifts a page out of the journal, another hand reaches for the scissors, and a third hand tosses a brown piece of paper away while the camera briefly zooms in on the journal and the discarded paper before pulling back. The journal rests on a white tabletop alongside a jar of water and other office supplies.

action.brief: Arrange page protectors and discard paper
action.detailed: Place the “Finca” paper on the left page, lay a white protective sheet over it, tuck a brown ticket under the sheet on the right page, pin another ticket to the left side of the sheet, trim the top‑left corner, then lift a page, grab the scissors, and discard the brown paper.

nodes.plm_action: Placing ticket into pocket

nodes.plm_action: Sticking down paper into a pocket

nodes.plm_action: Trimming the edge of a page with scissors

nodes.plm_action: Trimming the paper to create a clean cut

There is a glass of water in the background and a clear case of " tape" to the right of the book. The book is slightly open. The person holding the scissors in the bottom left of the frame.

nodes.plm_action: Gathering items to include in the notebook

Thin rectangular pieces of cardstock are laid over the ticket and photo, trimmed into neat strips with black scissors, and the trimmed strips are pressed onto the page using a transparent tape dispenser. After that, additional thin paper cards are positioned on both pages and taped down, while a glass of water, scissors, and the tape dispenser remain visible in the background. nodes.plm_action: Place transparent tape on paper and stick it to scrapbook page
nodes.plm_caption: A person is using both hands to glue two pieces of paper into a book. They start by gluing a thin strip of tape horizontally onto the open page in the middle. Then they take a rectangular piece of white paper and cut out the same amount of tape. They press down the two papers with their left hand, take the white piece off, cut the other end of the white piece of paper, put it back in between the two papers, and press down. They then grab a pair of scissors and cut off the excess paper on the right side. In the end, they cut off the left side and pull the white piece of paper off of the right side. All throughout, they are using scissors to cut the tape when necessary. They use a thin blade of scissors and hold them using the thumb, index, and middle finger of their right hand, with the ring and pinky finger curled in. On the left-hand side, they hold onto the white tape between the thumb, middle, ring, and pinky finger, with the index finger underneath it. The book and tape/ paper are on a light colored surface, and the scissors, tape dispenser, ticket, and clear jar full of water are also visible on the surface in front of the person. There is a small portion of their shoulder visible as well, and their left arm goes out of frame from the side of the camera angle. The lighting is bright.

summary.brief: Hands tape a strip to a journal page, sandwich a white translucent sheet, trim the excess and then lift the sheet off.

A rectangular white translucent sheet is laid on the tape and pressed down with the left hand. The sheet is lifted, one end is cut to the size of the tape, then placed back and pressed again. Scissors are then used to trim the excess paper on the right side, followed by trimming the left side, and finally the white sheet is lifted off the page. Throughout the process a tape dispenser, scissors, a ticket stub, a clear water jar and other paper scraps are visible on the bright tabletop.

action.detailed: Place a strip of tape on the open page, lay a white translucent sheet over the tape, press it, cut away the excess with scissors, and then remove the sheet.

A piece of paper is shifted leftward across the surface and a small black pen is used to underline or circle part of it. Finally, a small, unidentifiable object is dragged leftward until it leaves the frame.

nodes.plm_action: Peel stickers away from backing paper
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows someone trying to remove a sticker from the back of a movie ticket. The person only succeeds on the first try. Then they try again and finally succeed on the second try.
The surface being modified is a white square-like piece of paper. The ticket is attached to a white, rectangular-shaped piece of plastic. The ticket also has a bar code that the person pulls off the back of the plastic in the video.
The person is moving the ticket left, right, and back and forth to remove the back cover. Their right hand holds the cover as they pull it away from the ticket. Their left hand is on the ticket to hold it in place.
The background is a white surface. There are scissors and the top of a blue pen on the right side. A glass is also visible at the top left. There are more paper and scissors visible on the right side and in the left of the frame.

summary.brief: The maker peels the sticker backing from a concert ticket and places the ticket onto a paper base in the journal.
summary.detailed: On a white tabletop cluttered with scissors, a blue pen cap, a glass of water and other craft supplies, the creator’s left hand holds a rectangular concert ticket while the right hand grips the thin plastic backing. The right hand pulls the backing back, first loosening the sticker without fully removing it, then readjusts and pulls again until the adhesive layer separates completely. After the backing is removed, the ticket is turned over, examined, and set onto a square piece of paper that will serve as the foundation for the journal spread.

action.detailed: Hold the ticket with the left hand, grip the plastic backing with the right hand, pull back and readjust until the sticker separates, then position the freed ticket onto a paper base.
action.actor: the person crafting the journal (their hands)

nodes.plm_action: Cutting out sections of paper
nodes.plm_caption: A man performs an arts and crafts project on his desk with a journal and a pair of scissors. The camera is set above the man, so his hands are visible on the bottom of the frame and the journal is lying on the table, the scissors lying next to it. The man’s hands move around, but the project he is making is not visible. He occasionally goes out of the view of the camera frame and places the paper in his left hand. The frame then cuts to a blue handheld tape dispenser, before cutting back to the man's hands. The man places the dispenser next to the scissors and grabs a piece of paper. The paper is cut out of frame, and the man comes back in front of the camera. He flips the piece of paper over so the other side is facing the camera, then turns his left hand forward to place it on top of the journal cover. He turns his hand back out of frame, as the video ends. The background is an empty white table surface with a small glass jar with water in it and various little scraps and objects on the table.

nodes.plm_action: Folding and gluing receipt into small rectangle

nodes.plm_action: Opening a journal with a clip closure
nodes.plm_caption:
A person touches and unclips a journal and begins opening it in the video. In the background there is a white wall.
The video starts with a yellow text on a black background saying "me", and "journal with me".
The journal is unclipped by the person using their hands, and the right hand is placed on top of the clip. They then remove the clip and the journal falls over to the left side. The hand then moves towards the left corner to pick up the journal, and is placed on the opposite side of the table while opening the journal to look inside. The hand is then moved to the right, where the middle finger touches the middle of the journal, while the left hand is placed on the left page. The left hand then moves over to the right side to begin opening a page. At 0:04. The right hand places itself on top of the journal, while the left hand turns the page forward. The hand then turns the page back by pushing it back against the middle finger, before moving over to the right side.

nodes.plm_action: Using scrapbook paper to add embellishments and journaling
nodes.plm_caption:
A journal is opened on a white table, and the person carefully places a piece of paper in a decorative brown paper above it, adds another piece of clear paper, and then a brown, irregularly shaped piece of paper over the previous layers, before finally placing a torn piece of the same brown paper on top. The person then goes to add a piece of card, and the video cuts.
The background is a plain white table. A book or journal is on the table.

summary.brief: Hands add a folded card and several layers of paper, cardstock and torn pieces to an open journal page.
summary.detailed: The open journal lies flat on a white tabletop. First, the creator’s left hand folds a card and places it on the left side of the spread. After a short pause, a cream‑colored sheet with writing is positioned on the left page, followed by a brown strip that partially overlaps the cream sheet. The right page is then turned outward, and a long vertical piece bearing gray text is placed in the top‑left corner of the left page. The brown strip is lifted off and set aside. Next, a rectangular cardstock featuring a brown floral pattern is carefully laid onto the spread, its edges joined by a thin strip of semi‑transparent tape. In the final moments, two hands remove brown and tan paper scraps from the edge of a black‑covered book, tear them into smaller bits, and arrange those fragments on the blank page, ending with a dried brown rectangular piece being placed on the page before the cut.

action.detailed: Place the folded card, then the cream‑colored sheet, overlay the brown strip, add the vertical gray‑text paper, remove the strip, lay the floral cardstock, tear brown and tan scraps and affix them, and finish by positioning a brown rectangular piece on the page.

The page is placed in the center of a white surface.  The edge of a book, with a small circular hole with a clip hanging from it, is to the right of the page. A hand holding a book of papers enters at the left side.   It pulls a small section of off-white paper with writing on it from the left page towards the right page.  A hand with a black ring enters at the lower left edge of the video. It reaches towards the center of the page. The video then cuts to a hand holding the right page of the book up away from the center of the page. The hand begins to place the right side of the page down, on the center of the page.

summary.brief: The maker cuts and arranges paper pieces onto an open journal spread.
summary.detailed: An overhead view shows an open journal on a white surface. A hand places a white card on the table, then picks up black‑handled scissors and cuts a strip of brown paper, tearing it into smaller pieces. Another hand pulls a small off‑white sheet with printed text toward the centre of the spread. The right page of the journal is lifted, the cut brown strip and the off‑white sheet are positioned onto the blank right page, and the page is lowered back into place, completing the arrangement.

action.detailed: Cut a strip of brown paper, tear it into pieces, pull an off‑white printed sheet toward the centre, lift the right page of the journal, place the cut pieces and sheet onto the blank page, and lower the page back into position.

nodes.plm_action: Use transparent tape to hold down scrapbook pages in place

The hands continue adding a strip of a white paper with a sticky substance with the ticket placed over the paper and between the ticket and the paper, which they press with their middle finger. The hands move the ticket and the paper upwards with the ticket being removed from the screen and finally placing the ticket and paper on a white surface with scissors and a hole punch in the background.

summary.brief: Hands attach a ticket and photos to a journal page using adhesive strips.

The hands then lift the ticket and paper together, shift them upward, and place the combined piece onto a white surface where scissors and a hole‑punch are visible. Next, a thin clear plastic strip is positioned over two photos and a receipt on the notebook page, pressed briefly, and then the strip and photos are lifted and set to the right side of the page.

action.detailed: Place the ticket on the paper, lay the white sticky strip over it and press firmly with the middle finger, then lift and reposition the ticket and paper onto the surface; afterward, lay the plastic strip over the photos and receipt, press down, lift the strip and photos, and set them onto the notebook page.

The hands pick up scissors, a sheet of paper, another sheet of paper, a black paintbrush, and a glass of water, as the music fades out. The video is in fast motion, and the video speed is sped up.

The right hand then moves to grab a glass jar full of water and a black paintbrush. The left hand dips the paintbrush into the water and raises out of frame.
The journal is seen open on a white desk. The camera is seen in a top down perspective moving from left to right. The music is upbeat and then fades out.
The lighting is bright and there are a lot of items visible as well including some of the journal pages.

summary.detailed: From a top‑down view an open journal lies on a white desk. A hand lifts a black‑and‑white photograph (or sheet) and presses it onto the left page, then slides a pair of scissors across the spread before the scissors disappear out of frame. The same hand opens another sheet, folds it slightly, closes it again and moves away. A small card printed with Spanish words “Finca el …” is placed on top of the journal pages. Another hand reaches for a small glass jar of water and a black paintbrush; the brush is dipped into the water, lifted out and the bristles are tapped against the jar rim before the hand retreats. Throughout the 13‑second segment the movements are rapid and the upbeat music fades out.

action.detailed: Place the photograph onto the left page of the open journal, slide the scissors across the page, fold and set aside another sheet, position the Spanish‑text card on the spread, then grab the water jar and brush, dip the brush into the water and tap the bristles before withdrawing it.
action.actor: the journal maker (hands of the creator)

nodes.plm_action: Applying gentle, sweeping strokes with a watercolor brush

nodes.plm_action: Dipping bristles into vibrant paint

The journal is sitting on a white table with water, scissors, and a sheet of paper. The person is using the right hand, and the left hand rests on the journal's edge to hold it down. The journal's pages are white. The paintbrush is black, and the colors on the palette are red, green, blue, purple, yellow, orange, and pink. The person only picks up the red one.

nodes.plm_action: Dipping brush into light red paint and adding additional touches of watercolor to the paper

The background is white and on the left side is a set of watercolor paint. The paint is also on a grey piece of paper in the top left corner that has the word 'finca' in black and has other letters off screen. At 9s there is a big blur motion that obscures the artist hand until 17s when it reappears and it is holding the paintbrush back towards the orange watercolor paint. There is an open black book. It is closed to the left page and the right page has orange colored lines across it that are painted with orange watercolor paint. There is a black pair of scissors at 17s and a white round with holes on the sides. There is a greenish jar with liquid at 13s. A purple piece of paper with the word 'finca' is on the white surface and off-screen. The artist holds the paintbrush in his hand and does paint on the right page of the book. At 13s the paintbrush is dip into the orange watercolor paint and back to the book. At 17s the paintbrush is at the top of the left page of the book.

summary.brief: An artist paints orange watercolor onto the pages of an open journal.
summary.detailed: In a close‑up view a hand holds a watercolor brush while the other hand steadies an open black‑covered journal on a white tabletop. The brush is dipped into orange pigment on a palette, briefly rinsed in a water jar, and then swept across the right‑hand page, leaving a series of orange strokes. The brush then touches another colour on the palette before returning to orange, and later moves to the top of the left‑hand page. Around the journal sit a pair of black scissors, a small piece of paper with the word “finca,” and other art‑supply items.

nodes.plm_action: Applying watercolor paint to the page in smooth, flowing strokes
nodes.plm_caption:
The video features a close-up shot of a man with a sketchbook in front of him, coloring with the tips of the tip. The camera is close enough to show the brush strokes as he colors.
The man uses a black brush held in his right hand, and his left hand holds down the left side of the sketchbook with his thumb resting on the page. He starts near the top of the page on the left, brushing up and down in the space until he reaches the top edge of the book. After the first stroke, he dips the brush in the paint in a watercolor palette and applies it once more. The person is moving his right arm horizontally left and right, making one stroke for one complete section. Then he moves his arm downward toward the bottom of the page, then up again to the top of the page with the same stroke. At the end of the video, he begins to move his right hand horizontally to the right, only part of his arm is visible in the shot.

The person's work space is set against a white desk, and there are several objects visible, including the watercolor palette, a glass of water on the left, and a pair of black scissors on the right. A paper with "Finca" written on it is behind the sketchbook and in front of the watercolor palette. The person's skin is white.

They then leave the paint brush in a glass of water for a few seconds before putting the brush out of the shot. The video then cuts to the end of the page that has already been painted. 
The sketchbook and paper is on a white surface. A pair of black scissors and a pair of safety pins lies next to it. Also to the left of the sketchbook there is a paintbrush, a glass of water, and a paint pallet with different shades of water color. To the upper right, there is a piece of paper with "Finca" written on it.

Next, the hand lifts the lower corner of the current page slightly before lowering it again. The view then shows a pink watercolor painting on the page, and the hand turns the following page over to continue the spread.

The background of the image is a plain white desk, which provides a clean and minimalist setting for the various objects. Overall, the image appears to be a still life photograph, capturing a moment in time when the person's arm is resting on the desk, surrounded by these everyday items.

The ticket is then set onto the paper and a piece of transparent tape from the dispenser is pressed onto it to hold it in place. A thin translucent strip of paper is laid over the ticket and a second piece of tape is applied to secure the layer. Scissors, a glass cup and other supplies remain on the surface but are not used during this interval.

nodes.plm_caption:
This is a video of hands using tape and a receipt in a scrapbook.  The person is working with their hand visible, on a background of an opened scrapbook on a white counter.  In the background of the scrapbook, is a small water glass and a roll of scissor blades, a blue tape dispenser, small torn paper and a white book with writing on it.   There is a rectangular receipt being placed in a pocket of the scrapbook, and tape being placed over the receipt.   The person's hands move from the right side of the screen to the left side.  The background and objects are only visible if light hits them from the left side.  There is a small amount of light hitting the tape dispenser. The rest of the area is dark, like shadow, and the focus is on the hands and the items being used.
The video begins with only the hand visible holding a white piece of tape being placed in a pocket of an opened scrapbook, on a white surface.  The video then cuts and the two hands appear both coming from the right side of the screen and one hand moving the blue tape dispenser.  When the tape dispenser is opened the small piece of tape sticking out is placed over the piece of paper being held in the other hand and then put back in the dispenser.

summary.brief: Hands place a ticket in a scrapbook pocket and secure it with clear tape.
summary.detailed: The creator positions a rectangular ticket into a pocket on the right side of the open scrapbook spread, then pulls a short piece of clear tape from a blue dispenser, lays the tape over the ticket, presses down to adhere it, and finally lowers the dispenser back onto the surface.

action.detailed: Pull a strip of clear tape from the blue dispenser, position it over the ticket that has been placed in the scrapbook pocket, press firmly to attach the ticket, and then set the dispenser back down.

nodes.plm_action: Opening the diary to show contents
nodes.plm_caption:
This video shows someone untying the black string on a black journal with hands that are showing from the elbow down. They turn the journal over to reveal the white papers inside, and they then open the pages up and close it. The background is white.
The person holds the journal with their left hand at the bottom and their thumb on top. Their right hand uses the index finger and thumb to open the loop of the black string attached to the black cover. Then the person flips the journal over to show the black cover on the left side and the white pages inside. They flip it back over to show the pages from the other side. They then flip it open again, showing a new blank sheet of paper on both white pages. Finally, they flip it closed.
In the left of the video are words written in bold, yellow font that say "journal with me". At the end there are more words in the same font. To the right are squiggly lines of bold, yellow font and also in the video.

nodes.plm_action: Hold leather book cover with both hands, thumbs on top, and fingers curled around bottom

There are several blank pages, and the diary has a ring binder on the right-hand side of the book. A small blackish tab is also seen on the right side of the book. The video is in slow motion.
nodes.llama3_caption: This image depicts a person's hands interacting with a whiteboard, positioned in the bottom left corner of the frame. The whiteboard features a black border and a small black clip on the right side, attached to a white wall. The person's hands are visible, with their fingers pressed against the whiteboard, as if they are drawing or writing on it. The background is a plain white wall, providing a clean and minimalist context for the scene.

nodes.plm_action: Selecting paper for the journal cover

summary.brief: A hand folds a white scrap paper and places it on an open journal spread, then slides it across the page.
summary.detailed: The camera shows an open journal spread with a brown leather‑bound book on a white surface. A left hand lifts a white scrapbook sheet, folds it in half, and positions the folded sheet on the left side of the spread, pressing it down with the thumb while the other fingers hold it in place. The hand then moves the paper left‑to‑right across the page, adjusting its position among the surrounding items.

action.detailed: Fold the white paper in half, lay it onto the left side of the open journal spread, press it with the thumb, and then slide it across the page from left to right.

nodes.plm_action: Adding texture to the page
nodes.plm_caption: This video features a person applying papers on top of the page of an open notebook that is laying flat on a white surface. As they use their hands.

summary.brief: Hands place and adjust cream‑colored, brown, gray‑texted, and floral cardstock pieces, then tear and add extra paper scraps to an open journal.
summary.detailed: The clip opens with an overhead view of the maker’s right hand laying a cream‑colored sheet with writing onto the left page of an open journal, then adding a brown strip that overlaps it. The right page is turned over and a tall vertical strip bearing gray text is positioned at the top‑left corner; the brown strip is then removed. Next, a brown cardstock printed with small flower motifs is carefully placed onto the page, its edge joined to another piece by a thin strip of tape. The view shifts to a close‑up of the hands on a black‑covered book: brown and tan paper pieces are lifted from the left edge and affixed to a blank page while a light‑beige sheet with tiny letters rests on the opposite side. The hands tear a brown card and a pink‑white card into smaller fragments, placing the torn bits onto the page, and finally lay a brown rectangular fragment onto the spread as various small supplies remain on the tabletop.

action.detailed: Place the cream‑colored sheet, brown strip, and gray‑texted vertical strip onto the left page, flip the right page, attach the floral brown cardstock, then remove brown and tan scraps from the edge of the black‑covered book, tear them into pieces, and affix the resulting fragments and a light‑beige paper onto the blank page.

nodes.plm_action: Cutting strips of paper to add as accents

There is a book open on the table with a brown square-shaped sheet of paper taped onto it. There is a black pin on the side of the book.

summary.brief: A hand cuts a strip from a white card, tears it into ribbons, and slides a torn piece across an open journal.
summary.detailed: A white card is placed on a flat white tabletop beside an open journal. The journal’s left page has a brown square sheet of paper taped to it and a black metal pin rests on the right side of the spread. A hand picks up a pair of black scissors, cuts a narrow strip from the white card, and then tears the strip into thinner ribbons. One of the torn ribbons, showing a large brown floral pattern on its right half and fine black text on its left half, is lifted over the centre of the journal and gently slid off the page while the opposite page remains blank.

action.detailed: Use scissors to cut a strip from the white card, tear the strip into a thin ribbon, then hold the torn piece and slide it across the open journal.

nodes.plm_action: Holding ticket stub to serve as reference for cutting

In the center of the frame is a dark brown journal, half open, with the left page displaying a large brown design on white paper. The right page is blank.  On the work surface is a rectangular piece of brown material with light-colored spots. This is partially attached to the left page and a rectangular cream-colored piece of material with light-colored spots lies flat on the work surface and next to the journal. There is a sheet of off-white paper with writing on it and a small round brown piece of material on the right side. A pair of black scissors is used. A human hand with a white tape on a white surface. At 3s a pair of scissors with a black handle is lifted into frame. The scissors are then placed out of frame at 9s. At 13s the hand lifts the strip of material, partially cut, and the journal is picked up. At 28s the right hand places the brown piece of material in the journal. The video is sped up.

The person's hands can be seen placing and removing the plastic strip. His left hand is holding the plastic strip in place with all of its fingers, but when the photo is removed it leaves the strip's hold by slightly lifting the middle part of the middle finger of the left hand from the strip. His left hand also removes the strip from the edge of the page by lifting up the left middle finger of the left hand from the plastic strip.
The person's arm is hairy, and is seen wiggling when raising it. The receipt sticks out as the plastic strip is removed from the photo. There is also a black scissor on the top left corner of the notebook, placed on a white surface.
The lighting in the room is bright.

summary.brief: A hand opens a pocketbook, puts a stapler on it, and presses the stapler down.

Large black scissors lie to the right and a short white staple container to the left. A hand enters from the left, briefly opens the pocketbook, slides rightward and places a stapler on top of the book. Another hand pushes down on the stapler, then withdraws, leaving the stapler pressed onto the pocketbook.

The person is also wearing a watch. There is a pair of scissors in front of the paper, and a water bottle on the left side. The person is in a white background, on a white surface. There is also a black and white paper in front of them.
The video begins with a shot of a person holding a ticket and facing toward the camera. The person removes a square-shaped piece of paper underneath the ticket, then holds up the ticket to the light. Then the person turns the ticket over to the other side and lifts the square-shaped piece of paper. The person looks at the backside of the ticket and places the square-shaped piece of paper on top of the ticket. The person lifts the ticket and holds it over the square-shaped piece of paper.
The video ends with the person placing the ticket back onto the square-shaped piece of paper, and the person places the ticket down on the white surface.

summary.brief: A ticket is taped onto a journal page.
summary.detailed: Close‑up hands open a black‑covered journal that already shows a small white label with black cursive “day” in the upper left corner, ink writing, and other paper elements. A printed concert ticket is positioned on the right side; clear tape is placed on the back of the ticket, the ticket is flipped to show its front, and both hands hold it while the other hand presses down to smooth the tape and secure the ticket to the page. A pair of black scissors, a blue tape dispenser and a glass of water are visible in the background. After pressing, the hands release, leaving the ticket neatly adhered to the spread.

action.detailed: Place the ticket on the journal page, apply clear tape to its back, press it down firmly with both hands, and then release the hands.

summary.brief: Hands write decorative lettering, place paper strips, a sticker and a ruler, and layer a small notebook onto a scrapbook page.
summary.detailed: The clip begins with a pair of hands using a stencil and a pen to write decorative lettering on a grid‑lined journal page. A clear rectangular guide (or piece of cardboard) is lifted and positioned over the page while the word “Saphir” is written, then a brown‑black paper strip is added and the word “Famad” is inked. The guide is moved on and off the surface as the creator continues to write. Next, colored paper strips are placed on the left and right pages, a sheet of graph paper is positioned on the left side, and a ruler is set on top of the new strip. A small sticker is lifted with the pen and adhered vertically to the page. The hands then lift a smaller notebook and lay it on top of the larger journal before writing further. Throughout, a pair of scissors, a jar, and other craft supplies remain visible on the plain white table.

action.detailed: Using a pen and a stencil, write decorative words on the journal page while covering the surface with a clear guide, then place colored paper strips, a sheet of graph paper and a ruler on the pages, affix a sticker, and layer a small notebook onto the spread as you continue writing.

The video ends with the left hand still touching the white paper. It is on the left side of the open pages.
It begins with a shot of a spread in an open book. Two blank pages are open. We see some papers piled on the left side of the shot, held by the left hand. At 2s, the papers are lifted slightly before being set down on the left side of the shot. The right hand enters the shot from the left and the papers are held up with the thumb visible on the back of the paper and the other fingers on the front of the paper. They are pushed to the left, left of the book. The papers are stacked on top of each other in a row. The paper at the front is held slightly folded to show the surface before it is added to the other papers. At 4s, the papers are set down on top of the empty book. The fingers of the left hand pick up the papers and the book. The left-hand flips them all up so that the palm of the left hand is facing the right side of the shot, and then puts the paper on top of the book with the thumbs on the top and the other fingers curling below it, holding it in place. The left thumb presses down on the paper at the top center and the remaining fingers curl on the bottom.  The hand exits the shot at 7s.

A hand places a cream‑colored sheet with writing onto the left page, then adds a brown strip that partly overlaps the cream paper. The right page is flipped over to the right. Using the right hand, a long vertical piece of paper bearing gray text is pulled into the top‑left corner of the left page. Finally, the brown strip is lifted off, leaving the cream paper and the gray‑texted strip arranged on the spread. The whole sequence is shown in fast motion against a plain white wall.

nodes.plm_action: Adding extra watercolor to create contrast in painting
nodes.plm_caption:
This video shows a person setting up their art station. They have an open book and are mixing paints with water and an artist brush. A pair of scissors, art paper and painting palette are also visible.
The person's hands are on the left of the frame. They move one hand left to left along the spine of the empty book. nodes.plm_action: Secure ticket with tape or glue
nodes.plm_caption:
The video shows a man demonstrating how to attach a ticket to a stack of papers.  The ticket is held in his right hand and is being placed on the stack of papers. The stack of papers is held in place by a ruler that is also held in place by the left hand. There is a glass of water and a scissor set to the left of the stack. There is also a tape dispenser to the right of the stack. The table the items are on is white.
The man first measures the ticket using the ruler. He places the ticket on top of the papers. He moves the ticket to the left slightly using his left hand. Then he puts the ticket back in the middle of the papers. He lifts the ticket up and puts it on the right. He lifts the ticket up again and moves it slightly to the left.  The video ends with the man tapping both hands on the papers at the end of the step.

summary.brief: A man aligns and affixes a concert ticket onto a stack of papers using a ruler.
summary.detailed: Holding a ruler with his left hand to keep a stack of paper steady, the man lifts the ticket with his right hand, measures it against the ruler, places it on the top of the stack, nudges it slightly left, recenters it, then lifts it again to move it toward the right edge, shifts it a little left, and finishes by tapping both hands on the papers to secure the ticket.

action.detailed: Place the ticket onto the stacked papers, use the ruler to measure and align it, adjust its position left, centre, and right, then tap the papers to secure it.

A hand lifts one strip, aligns it with the left page, and uses the blue tape dispenser to lay a thin piece of tape that adheres the strip to the page. The tape dispenser is then set aside and a roll of tape is placed on the table. The hand switches to a glue gun (or blue glue stick) to apply glue and press additional paper pieces onto the page, ensuring they stick firmly while the surrounding supplies remain visible.

summary.brief: The creator arranges decorative paper and a clear overlay on a journal page while writing the words “Saphir” and “Famad.”
summary.detailed: In a close‑up of a white desk, the creator lifts a clear square overlay (cardboard) and places it over the left side of an open black journal that already has a collage of brown‑black paper and handwritten text. Using an art tablet as a guide, she positions additional brown and black paper strips and a sticker, briefly removes the overlay to adjust the layout, and then replaces it. She writes the word “Saphir” (with the “i” in black ink) through the overlay, adds the word “Famad” on the page, and lays a ruler across a newly added strip of paper. A pair of scissors can be seen in the lower‑right corner of the frame.

action.detailed: Place a clear square overlay on the journal page, use the tablet to align and add paper strips and a sticker, lift and replace the overlay as needed, then write the words “Saphir” and “Famad” with a pen while positioning a ruler over the new strip.

A piece of paper that is partially cut off is visible next to the sketch pad. The person holding the paintbrush starts loading it with yellow paint. The paintbrush is the only moving object in this video.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a white desk or table with various art supplies scattered around it. The overall atmosphere suggests a creative workspace where someone is engaged in artistic activities.

Here are the main objects in the image:

* A white notebook with a brown cover and blank pages:
	+ Opened to a page with a black clip holding it in place
	+ Lying flat on the desk, taking center stage
* A pair of black scissors with a circular handle:
	+ Placed to the right of the notebook, slightly out of focus
	+ Suggests that the person may be cutting or trimming paper or other materials
* A watercolor paint palette with various colors:
	+ Located to the left of the notebook, partially visible
	+ Contains a range of colors, including blues, greens, yellows, and oranges
	+ Suggests that the person is working with watercolors
* A small container of white paint:
	+ Situated above the paint palette, slightly out of focus
	+ May be used for mixing or adding highlights to artwork
* A piece of paper with the word "Finc" printed on it:
	+ Lies on the desk, partially visible, with only the first few letters of the word "Finc" showing
	+ May be a title or heading for a project or piece of art

Overall, the image suggests a creative and artistic workspace where someone is engaged in various activities, including writing, drawing, and painting. The presence of a notebook, scissors, and paint palette indicates that the person is working on a project that requires precision and attention to detail.

nodes.plm_action: Remove paper strips from pockets
nodes.plm_caption: The video displays a person interacting with a book that features photographs and writing. The person uses both hands to pull an item from the book and carefully places it back on the page as the video comes to an end.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a person engaged in a creative activity, with their arm visible as they work on a book or magazine. The person's hand is holding a pen or pencil, poised over a page filled with brown and white scribbles, while their arm rests on a white surface.

**Key Elements:**

* **Person's Hand:** The hand is holding a writing instrument, with the arm resting on the surface.
* **Book or Magazine:** The book or magazine is open to a page featuring brown and white scribbles.
* **Writing Instrument:** The pen or pencil is held by the person's hand, ready to create.
* **Surface:** The white surface provides a clean and neutral background for the activity.
* **Additional Objects:** A pair of scissors and a glass of water are placed nearby, suggesting a workspace or studio environment.

**Overall Impression:**

The image conveys a sense of creativity and productivity, with the person focused on their work. The use of a pen or pencil and the presence of a book or magazine suggest a creative or artistic endeavor. The white surface and surrounding objects add to the overall atmosphere of a workspace or studio.

nodes.plm_action: Transferring ticket stubs to journal
nodes.plm_caption:
The video displays a pair of hands holding a ticket over a journal. In the journal are printed images and words. Next to the journal are a pair of black scissors, a jar of water, and a blue tape dispenser.
The right hand holds the ticket in between the thumb, index finger, and middle finger. As the ticket is held, it is slowly lifted away from the journal page.
The video is a closeup of the hands and the objects next to them. The rest of the background is white and out of frame.
nodes.llama3_caption:
The image depicts a hand holding a ticket stub over a book, with the title "Fina el" visible. The purpose of the image is to showcase the ticket stub and its relationship to the book.

Here are the details of the image:

* A hand holding a ticket stub:
	+ The hand is fair-skinned and has short fingernails.
	+ The ticket stub is white with black text and has a perforated edge.
	+ The hand is holding the ticket stub between the thumb and index finger.
* A book with the title "Fina el":
	+ The book is open to a page with a brown cover and white pages.
	+ The title "Fina el" is written in large, dark gray letters on the right-hand page.
	+ The book appears to be a novel or a collection of stories.
* A pair of scissors:

nodes.plm_action: Applying a cut-out piece of paper onto a spread
nodes.plm_caption: The video shows a person adding a small card to a book. The person holds the card with their right thumb and index finger, and with their left index finger. It sits on a white flat surface, there is also a pair of scissors, a small bottle, and some other cards laying on the surface. There is a blue tape dispenser on the left side of the book.

nodes.plm_action: Add cut paper to journal page
nodes.plm_caption: An overhead view of a pair of hands creating a small, thin sticker and taping it on to the left page of a book. They then hold the tape dispenser at the top of the page and move their right hand towards it. The work is on a white, flat surface. In the background and foreground are various craft supplies, including scissors, a glass cup of water, a blue tape dispenser, a receipt and a small piece of brown cardboard.

nodes.plm_action: Glue down small pieces of paper and images onto the page

The book is open on a white table in front of the person and has a folded piece of paper stuck to the left page. Various small pieces of paper are scattered around the table on the left and right sides of the book. A pair of black scissors with their handles sticking up is next to the book, with one small, cut piece of paper underneath them. A jar of water is in the upper-left corner.
